text: Then the Lord spoke to Moses in the wilderness of Sinai, in the tent of meeting, on the first of the second month, in the second year after they had come out of the land of Egypt, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Take a census of all the congregation of the sons of Israel, by their families, by their fathers’ households, according to the number of names, every male, head by head
speaker: Narrator

text: from twenty years old and upward, whoever is able to go out to war in Israel, you and Aaron shall number them by their armies.
speaker: Narrator

text: With you, moreover, there shall be a man of each tribe, each one head of his father’s household.
speaker: Narrator

text: These then are the names of the men who shall stand with you: of Reuben, Elizur the son of Shedeur;
speaker: Narrator

text: of Simeon, Shelumiel the son of Zurishaddai;
speaker: Narrator

text: of Judah, Nahshon the son of Amminadab;
speaker: Narrator

text: of Issachar, Nethanel the son of Zuar;
speaker: Narrator

text: of Zebulun, Eliab the son of Helon;
speaker: Narrator

text: of the sons of Joseph: of Ephraim, Elishama the son of Ammihud; of Manasseh, Gamaliel the son of Pedahzur;
speaker: Narrator

text: of Benjamin, Abidan the son of Gideoni;
speaker: Narrator

text: of Dan, Ahiezer the son of Ammishaddai;
speaker: Narrator

text: of Asher, Pagiel the son of Ochran;
speaker: Narrator

text: of Gad, Eliasaph the son of Deuel;
speaker: Narrator

text: of Naphtali, Ahira the son of Enan.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are they who were called of the congregation, the leaders of their fathers’ tribes; they were the heads of divisions of Israel.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Moses and Aaron took these men who had been designated by name,
speaker: Narrator

text: and they assembled all the congregation together on the first of the second month. Then they registered by ancestry in their families, by their fathers’ households, according to the number of names, from twenty years old and upward, head by head,
speaker: Narrator

text: just as the Lord had commanded Moses. So he numbered them in the wilderness of Sinai.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the sons of Reuben, Israel’s firstborn, their genealogical registration by their families, by their fathers’ households, according to the number of names, head by head, every male from twenty years old and upward, whoever was able to go out to war,
speaker: Narrator

text: their numbered men of the tribe of Reuben were 46,500.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of the sons of Simeon, their genealogical registration by their families, by their fathers’ households, their numbered men, according to the number of names, head by head, every male from twenty years old and upward, whoever was able to go out to war,
speaker: Narrator

text: their numbered men of the tribe of Simeon were 59,300.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of the sons of Gad, their genealogical registration by their families, by their fathers’ households, according to the number of names, from twenty years old and upward, whoever was able to go out to war,
speaker: Narrator

text: their numbered men of the tribe of Gad were 45,650.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of the sons of Judah, their genealogical registration by their families, by their fathers’ households, according to the number of names, from twenty years old and upward, whoever was able to go out to war,
speaker: Narrator

text: their numbered men of the tribe of Judah were 74,600.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of the sons of Issachar, their genealogical registration by their families, by their fathers’ households, according to the number of names, from twenty years old and upward, whoever was able to go out to war,
speaker: Narrator

text: their numbered men of the tribe of Issachar were 54,400.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of the sons of Zebulun, their genealogical registration by their families, by their fathers’ households, according to the number of names, from twenty years old and upward, whoever was able to go out to war,
speaker: Narrator

text: their numbered men of the tribe of Zebulun were 57,400.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of the sons of Joseph, namely, of the sons of Ephraim, their genealogical registration by their families, by their fathers’ households, according to the number of names, from twenty years old and upward, whoever was able to go out to war,
speaker: Narrator

text: their numbered men of the tribe of Ephraim were 40,500.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of the sons of Manasseh, their genealogical registration by their families, by their fathers’ households, according to the number of names, from twenty years old and upward, whoever was able to go out to war,
speaker: Narrator

text: their numbered men of the tribe of Manasseh were 32,200.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of the sons of Benjamin, their genealogical registration by their families, by their fathers’ households, according to the number of names, from twenty years old and upward, whoever was able to go out to war,
speaker: Narrator

text: their numbered men of the tribe of Benjamin were 35,400.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of the sons of Dan, their genealogical registration by their families, by their fathers’ households, according to the number of names, from twenty years old and upward, whoever was able to go out to war,
speaker: Narrator

text: their numbered men of the tribe of Dan were 62,700.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of the sons of Asher, their genealogical registration by their families, by their fathers’ households, according to the number of names, from twenty years old and upward, whoever was able to go out to war,
speaker: Narrator

text: their numbered men of the tribe of Asher were 41,500.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of the sons of Naphtali, their genealogical registration by their families, by their fathers’ households, according to the number of names, from twenty years old and upward, whoever was able to go out to war,
speaker: Narrator

text: their numbered men of the tribe of Naphtali were 53,400.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the ones who were numbered, whom Moses and Aaron numbered, with the leaders of Israel, twelve men, each of whom was of his father’s household.
speaker: Narrator

text: So all the numbered men of the sons of Israel by their fathers’ households, from twenty years old and upward, whoever was able to go out to war in Israel,
speaker: Narrator

text: even all the numbered men were 603,550.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Levites, however, were not numbered among them by their fathers’ tribe.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the Lord had spoken to Moses, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Only the tribe of Levi you shall not number, nor shall you take their census among the sons of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: But you shall appoint the Levites over the tabernacle of the testimony, and over all its furnishings and over all that belongs to it. They shall carry the tabernacle and all its furnishings, and they shall take care of it; they shall also camp around the tabernacle.
speaker: Narrator

text: So when the tabernacle is to set out, the Levites shall take it down; and when the tabernacle encamps, the Levites shall set it up. But the layman who comes near shall be put to death.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Israel shall camp, each man by his own camp, and each man by his own standard, according to their armies.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the Levites shall camp around the tabernacle of the testimony, so that there will be no wrath on the congregation of the sons of Israel. So the Levites shall keep charge of the tabernacle of the testimony.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus the sons of Israel did; according to all which the Lord had commanded Moses, so they did.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the Lord spoke to Moses and to Aaron, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “The sons of Israel shall camp, each by his own standard, with the banners of their fathers’ households; they shall camp around the tent of meeting at a distance.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now those who camp on the east side toward the sunrise shall be of the standard of the camp of Judah, by their armies, and the leader of the sons of Judah: Nahshon the son of Amminadab,
speaker: Narrator

text: and his army, even their numbered men, 74,600.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those who camp next to him shall be the tribe of Issachar, and the leader of the sons of Issachar: Nethanel the son of Zuar,
speaker: Narrator

text: and his army, even their numbered men, 54,400.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then comes the tribe of Zebulun, and the leader of the sons of Zebulun: Eliab the son of Helon,
speaker: Narrator

text: and his army, even his numbered men, 57,400.
speaker: Narrator

text: The total of the numbered men of the camp of Judah: 186,400, by their armies. They shall set out first.
speaker: Narrator

text: “On the south side shall be the standard of the camp of Reuben by their armies, and the leader of the sons of Reuben: Elizur the son of Shedeur,
speaker: Narrator

text: and his army, even their numbered men, 46,500.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those who camp next to him shall be the tribe of Simeon, and the leader of the sons of Simeon: Shelumiel the son of Zurishaddai,
speaker: Narrator

text: and his army, even their numbered men, 59,300.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then comes the tribe of Gad, and the leader of the sons of Gad: Eliasaph the son of Deuel,
speaker: Narrator

text: and his army, even their numbered men, 45,650.
speaker: Narrator

text: The total of the numbered men of the camp of Reuben: 151,450 by their armies. And they shall set out second.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Then the tent of meeting shall set out with the camp of the Levites in the midst of the camps; just as they camp, so they shall set out, every man in his place by their standards.
speaker: Narrator

text: “On the west side shall be the standard of the camp of Ephraim by their armies, and the leader of the sons of Ephraim shall be Elishama the son of Ammihud,
speaker: Narrator

text: and his army, even their numbered men, 40,500.
speaker: Narrator

text: Next to him shall be the tribe of Manasseh, and the leader of the sons of Manasseh: Gamaliel the son of Pedahzur,
speaker: Narrator

text: and his army, even their numbered men, 32,200.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then comes the tribe of Benjamin, and the leader of the sons of Benjamin: Abidan the son of Gideoni,
speaker: Narrator

text: and his army, even their numbered men, 35,400.
speaker: Narrator

text: The total of the numbered men of the camp of Ephraim: 108,100, by their armies. And they shall set out third.
speaker: Narrator

text: “On the north side shall be the standard of the camp of Dan by their armies, and the leader of the sons of Dan: Ahiezer the son of Ammishaddai,
speaker: Narrator

text: and his army, even their numbered men, 62,700.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those who camp next to him shall be the tribe of Asher, and the leader of the sons of Asher: Pagiel the son of Ochran,
speaker: Narrator

text: and his army, even their numbered men, 41,500.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then comes the tribe of Naphtali, and the leader of the sons of Naphtali: Ahira the son of Enan,
speaker: Narrator

text: and his army, even their numbered men, 53,400.
speaker: Narrator

text: The total of the numbered men of the camp of Dan was 157,600. They shall set out last by their standards.”
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the numbered men of the sons of Israel by their fathers’ households; the total of the numbered men of the camps by their armies, 603,550.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Levites, however, were not numbered among the sons of Israel, just as the Lord had commanded Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus the sons of Israel did; according to all that the Lord commanded Moses, so they camped by their standards, and so they set out, every one by his family according to his father’s household.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now these are the records of the generations of Aaron and Moses at the time when the Lord spoke with Moses on Mount Sinai.
speaker: Narrator

text: These then are the names of the sons of Aaron: Nadab the firstborn, and Abihu, Eleazar and Ithamar.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the names of the sons of Aaron, the anointed priests, whom he ordained to serve as priests.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Nadab and Abihu died before the Lord when they offered strange fire before the Lord in the wilderness of Sinai; and they had no children. So Eleazar and Ithamar served as priests in the lifetime of their father Aaron.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Lord spoke to Moses, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Bring the tribe of Levi near and set them before Aaron the priest, that they may serve him.
speaker: Narrator

text: They shall perform the duties for him and for the whole congregation before the tent of meeting, to do the service of the tabernacle.
speaker: Narrator

text: They shall also keep all the furnishings of the tent of meeting, along with the duties of the sons of Israel, to do the service of the tabernacle.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall thus give the Levites to Aaron and to his sons; they are wholly given to him from among the sons of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: So you shall appoint Aaron and his sons that they may keep their priesthood, but the layman who comes near shall be put to death.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Again the Lord spoke to Moses, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Now, behold, I have taken the Levites from among the sons of Israel instead of every firstborn, the first issue of the womb among the sons of Israel. So the Levites shall be Mine.
speaker: Narrator

text: For all the firstborn are Mine; on the day that I struck down all the firstborn in the land of Egypt, I sanctified to Myself all the firstborn in Israel, from man to beast. They shall be Mine; I am the Lord.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Lord spoke to Moses in the wilderness of Sinai, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Number the sons of Levi by their fathers’ households, by their families; every male from a month old and upward you shall number.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Moses numbered them according to the word of the Lord, just as he had been commanded.
speaker: Narrator

text: These then are the sons of Levi by their names: Gershon and Kohath and Merari.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the names of the sons of Gershon by their families: Libni and Shimei;
speaker: Narrator

text: and the sons of Kohath by their families: Amram and Izhar, Hebron and Uzziel;
speaker: Narrator

text: and the sons of Merari by their families: Mahli and Mushi. These are the families of the Levites according to their fathers’ households.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of Gershon was the family of the Libnites and the family of the Shimeites; these were the families of the Gershonites.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their numbered men, in the numbering of every male from a month old and upward, even their numbered men were 7,500.
speaker: Narrator

text: The families of the Gershonites were to camp behind the tabernacle westward,
speaker: Narrator

text: and the leader of the fathers’ households of the Gershonites was Eliasaph the son of Lael.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the duties of the sons of Gershon in the tent of meeting involved the tabernacle and the tent, its covering, and the screen for the doorway of the tent of meeting,
speaker: Narrator

text: and the hangings of the court, and the screen for the doorway of the court which is around the tabernacle and the altar, and its cords, according to all the service concerning them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of Kohath was the family of the Amramites and the family of the Izharites and the family of the Hebronites and the family of the Uzzielites; these were the families of the Kohathites.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the numbering of every male from a month old and upward, there were 8,600, performing the duties of the sanctuary.
speaker: Narrator

text: The families of the sons of Kohath were to camp on the southward side of the tabernacle,
speaker: Narrator

text: and the leader of the fathers’ households of the Kohathite families was Elizaphan the son of Uzziel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now their duties involved the ark, the table, the lampstand, the altars, and the utensils of the sanctuary with which they minister, and the screen, and all the service concerning them;
speaker: Narrator

text: and Eleazar the son of Aaron the priest was the chief of the leaders of Levi, and had the oversight of those who perform the duties of the sanctuary.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of Merari was the family of the Mahlites and the family of the Mushites; these were the families of Merari.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their numbered men in the numbering of every male from a month old and upward, were 6,200.
speaker: Narrator

text: The leader of the fathers’ households of the families of Merari was Zuriel the son of Abihail. They were to camp on the northward side of the tabernacle.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the appointed duties of the sons of Merari involved the frames of the tabernacle, its bars, its pillars, its sockets, all its equipment, and the service concerning them,
speaker: Narrator

text: and the pillars around the court with their sockets and their pegs and their cords.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now those who were to camp before the tabernacle eastward, before the tent of meeting toward the sunrise, are Moses and Aaron and his sons, performing the duties of the sanctuary for the obligation of the sons of Israel; but the layman coming near was to be put to death.
speaker: Narrator

text: All the numbered men of the Levites, whom Moses and Aaron numbered at the command of the Lord by their families, every male from a month old and upward, were 22,000.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Lord said to Moses, “Number every firstborn male of the sons of Israel from a month old and upward, and make a list of their names.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall take the Levites for Me, I am the Lord, instead of all the firstborn among the sons of Israel, and the cattle of the Levites instead of all the firstborn among the cattle of the sons of Israel.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Moses numbered all the firstborn among the sons of Israel, just as the Lord had commanded him;
speaker: Narrator

text: and all the firstborn males by the number of names from a month old and upward, for their numbered men were 22,273.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Lord spoke to Moses, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Take the Levites instead of all the firstborn among the sons of Israel and the cattle of the Levites. And the Levites shall be Mine; I am the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the ransom of the 273 of the firstborn of the sons of Israel who are in excess beyond the Levites,
speaker: Narrator

text: you shall take five shekels apiece, per head; you shall take them in terms of the shekel of the sanctuary (the shekel is twenty gerahs),
speaker: Narrator

text: and give the money, the ransom of those who are in excess among them, to Aaron and to his sons.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Moses took the ransom money from those who were in excess, beyond those ransomed by the Levites;
speaker: Narrator

text: from the firstborn of the sons of Israel he took the money in terms of the shekel of the sanctuary, 1,365.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Moses gave the ransom money to Aaron and to his sons, at the command of the Lord, just as the Lord had commanded Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Lord spoke to Moses and to Aaron, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Take a census of the descendants of Kohath from among the sons of Levi, by their families, by their fathers’ households,
speaker: Narrator

text: from thirty years and upward, even to fifty years old, all who enter the service to do the work in the tent of meeting.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is the work of the descendants of Kohath in the tent of meeting, concerning the most holy things.
speaker: Narrator

text: “When the camp sets out, Aaron and his sons shall go in and they shall take down the veil of the screen and cover the ark of the testimony with it;
speaker: Narrator

text: and they shall lay a covering of porpoise skin on it, and shall spread over it a cloth of pure blue, and shall insert its poles.
speaker: Narrator

text: Over the table of the bread of the Presence they shall also spread a cloth of blue and put on it the dishes and the pans and the sacrificial bowls and the jars for the drink offering, and the continual bread shall be on it.
speaker: Narrator

text: They shall spread over them a cloth of scarlet material, and cover the same with a covering of porpoise skin, and they shall insert its poles.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they shall take a blue cloth and cover the lampstand for the light, along with its lamps and its snuffers, and its trays and all its oil vessels, by which they serve it;
speaker: Narrator

text: and they shall put it and all its utensils in a covering of porpoise skin, and shall put it on the carrying bars.
speaker: Narrator

text: Over the golden altar they shall spread a blue cloth and cover it with a covering of porpoise skin, and shall insert its poles;
speaker: Narrator

text: and they shall take all the utensils of service, with which they serve in the sanctuary, and put them in a blue cloth and cover them with a covering of porpoise skin, and put them on the carrying bars.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they shall take away the ashes from the altar, and spread a purple cloth over it.
speaker: Narrator

text: They shall also put on it all its utensils by which they serve in connection with it: the firepans, the forks and shovels and the basins, all the utensils of the altar; and they shall spread a cover of porpoise skin over it and insert its poles.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Aaron and his sons have finished covering the holy objects and all the furnishings of the sanctuary, when the camp is to set out, after that the sons of Kohath shall come to carry them, so that they will not touch the holy objects and die. These are the things in the tent of meeting which the sons of Kohath are to carry.
speaker: Narrator

text: “The responsibility of Eleazar the son of Aaron the priest is the oil for the light and the fragrant incense and the continual grain offering and the anointing oil—the responsibility of all the tabernacle and of all that is in it, with the sanctuary and its furnishings.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Lord spoke to Moses and to Aaron, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Do not let the tribe of the families of the Kohathites be cut off from among the Levites.
speaker: Narrator

text: But do this to them that they may live and not die when they approach the most holy objects: Aaron and his sons shall go in and assign each of them to his work and to his load;
speaker: Narrator

text: but they shall not go in to see the holy objects even for a moment, or they will die.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Lord spoke to Moses, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Take a census of the sons of Gershon also, by their fathers’ households, by their families;
speaker: Narrator

text: from thirty years and upward to fifty years old, you shall number them; all who enter to perform the service to do the work in the tent of meeting.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is the service of the families of the Gershonites, in serving and in carrying:
speaker: Narrator

text: they shall carry the curtains of the tabernacle and the tent of meeting with its covering and the covering of porpoise skin that is on top of it, and the screen for the doorway of the tent of meeting,
speaker: Narrator

text: and the hangings of the court, and the screen for the doorway of the gate of the court which is around the tabernacle and the altar, and their cords and all the equipment for their service; and all that is to be done, they shall perform.
speaker: Narrator

text: All the service of the sons of the Gershonites, in all their loads and in all their work, shall be performed at the command of Aaron and his sons; and you shall assign to them as a duty all their loads.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is the service of the families of the sons of the Gershonites in the tent of meeting, and their duties shall be under the direction of Ithamar the son of Aaron the priest.
speaker: Narrator

text: “As for the sons of Merari, you shall number them by their families, by their fathers’ households;
speaker: Narrator

text: from thirty years and upward even to fifty years old, you shall number them, everyone who enters the service to do the work of the tent of meeting.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now this is the duty of their loads, for all their service in the tent of meeting: the boards of the tabernacle and its bars and its pillars and its sockets,
speaker: Narrator

text: and the pillars around the court and their sockets and their pegs and their cords, with all their equipment and with all their service; and you shall assign each man by name the items he is to carry.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is the service of the families of the sons of Merari, according to all their service in the tent of meeting, under the direction of Ithamar the son of Aaron the priest.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Moses and Aaron and the leaders of the congregation numbered the sons of the Kohathites by their families and by their fathers’ households,
speaker: Narrator

text: from thirty years and upward even to fifty years old, everyone who entered the service for work in the tent of meeting.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their numbered men by their families were 2,750.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the numbered men of the Kohathite families, everyone who was serving in the tent of meeting, whom Moses and Aaron numbered according to the commandment of the Lord through Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: The numbered men of the sons of Gershon by their families and by their fathers’ households,
speaker: Narrator

text: from thirty years and upward even to fifty years old, everyone who entered the service for work in the tent of meeting.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their numbered men by their families, by their fathers’ households, were 2,630.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the numbered men of the families of the sons of Gershon, everyone who was serving in the tent of meeting, whom Moses and Aaron numbered according to the commandment of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: The numbered men of the families of the sons of Merari by their families, by their fathers’ households,
speaker: Narrator

text: from thirty years and upward even to fifty years old, everyone who entered the service for work in the tent of meeting.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their numbered men by their families were 3,200.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the numbered men of the families of the sons of Merari, whom Moses and Aaron numbered according to the commandment of the Lord through Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: All the numbered men of the Levites, whom Moses and Aaron and the leaders of Israel numbered, by their families and by their fathers’ households,
speaker: Narrator

text: from thirty years and upward even to fifty years old, everyone who could enter to do the work of service and the work of carrying in the tent of meeting.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their numbered men were 8,580.
speaker: Narrator

text: According to the commandment of the Lord through Moses, they were numbered, everyone by his serving or carrying; thus these were his numbered men, just as the Lord had commanded Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Lord spoke to Moses, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Command the sons of Israel that they send away from the camp every leper and everyone having a discharge and everyone who is unclean because of a dead person.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall send away both male and female; you shall send them outside the camp so that they will not defile their camp where I dwell in their midst.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Israel did so and sent them outside the camp; just as the Lord had spoken to Moses, thus the sons of Israel did.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Lord spoke to Moses, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Speak to the sons of Israel, ‘When a man or woman commits any of the sins of mankind, acting unfaithfully against the Lord, and that person is guilty,
speaker: Narrator

text: then he shall confess his sins which he has committed, and he shall make restitution in full for his wrong and add to it one-fifth of it, and give it to him whom he has wronged.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if the man has no relative to whom restitution may be made for the wrong, the restitution which is made for the wrong must go to the Lord for the priest, besides the ram of atonement, by which atonement is made for him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also every contribution pertaining to all the holy gifts of the sons of Israel, which they offer to the priest, shall be his.
speaker: Narrator

text: So every man’s holy gifts shall be his; whatever any man gives to the priest, it becomes his.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Lord spoke to Moses, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Speak to the sons of Israel and say to them, ‘If any man’s wife goes astray and is unfaithful to him,
speaker: Narrator

text: and a man has intercourse with her and it is hidden from the eyes of her husband and she is undetected, although she has defiled herself, and there is no witness against her and she has not been caught in the act,
speaker: Narrator

text: if a spirit of jealousy comes over him and he is jealous of his wife when she has defiled herself, or if a spirit of jealousy comes over him and he is jealous of his wife when she has not defiled herself,
speaker: Narrator

text: the man shall then bring his wife to the priest, and shall bring as an offering for her one-tenth of an ephah of barley meal; he shall not pour oil on it nor put frankincense on it, for it is a grain offering of jealousy, a grain offering of memorial, a reminder of iniquity.
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘Then the priest shall bring her near and have her stand before the Lord,
speaker: Narrator

text: and the priest shall take holy water in an earthenware vessel; and he shall take some of the dust that is on the floor of the tabernacle and put it into the water.
speaker: Narrator

text: The priest shall then have the woman stand before the Lord and let the hair of the woman’s head go loose, and place the grain offering of memorial in her hands, which is the grain offering of jealousy, and in the hand of the priest is to be the water of bitterness that brings a curse.
speaker: Narrator

text: The priest shall have her take an oath and shall say to the woman, “If no man has lain with you and if you have not gone astray into uncleanness, being under the authority of your husband, be immune to this water of bitterness that brings a curse;
speaker: Narrator

text: if you, however, have gone astray, being under the authority of your husband, and if you have defiled yourself and a man other than your husband has had intercourse with you”
speaker: Narrator

text: (then the priest shall have the woman swear with the oath of the curse, and the priest shall say to the woman), “the Lord make you a curse and an oath among your people by the Lord’s making your thigh waste away and your abdomen swell;
speaker: Narrator

text: and this water that brings a curse shall go into your stomach, and make your abdomen swell and your thigh waste away.” And the woman shall say, “Amen. Amen.”
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘The priest shall then write these curses on a scroll, and he shall wash them off into the water of bitterness.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he shall make the woman drink the water of bitterness that brings a curse, so that the water which brings a curse will go into her and cause bitterness.
speaker: Narrator

text: The priest shall take the grain offering of jealousy from the woman’s hand, and he shall wave the grain offering before the Lord and bring it to the altar;
speaker: Narrator

text: and the priest shall take a handful of the grain offering as its memorial offering and offer it up in smoke on the altar, and afterward he shall make the woman drink the water.
speaker: Narrator

text: When he has made her drink the water, then it shall come about, if she has defiled herself and has been unfaithful to her husband, that the water which brings a curse will go into her and cause bitterness, and her abdomen will swell and her thigh will waste away, and the woman will become a curse among her people.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if the woman has not defiled herself and is clean, she will then be free and conceive children.
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘This is the law of jealousy: when a wife, being under the authority of her husband, goes astray and defiles herself,
speaker: Narrator

text: or when a spirit of jealousy comes over a man and he is jealous of his wife, he shall then make the woman stand before the Lord, and the priest shall apply all this law to her.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover, the man will be free from guilt, but that woman shall bear her guilt.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: Again the Lord spoke to Moses, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Speak to the sons of Israel and say to them, ‘When a man or woman makes a special vow, the vow of a Nazirite, to dedicate himself to the Lord,
speaker: Narrator

text: he shall abstain from wine and strong drink; he shall drink no vinegar, whether made from wine or strong drink, nor shall he drink any grape juice nor eat fresh or dried grapes.
speaker: Narrator

text: All the days of his separation he shall not eat anything that is produced by the grape vine, from the seeds even to the skin.
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘All the days of his vow of separation no razor shall pass over his head. He shall be holy until the days are fulfilled for which he separated himself to the Lord; he shall let the locks of hair on his head grow long.
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘All the days of his separation to the Lord he shall not go near to a dead person.
speaker: Narrator

text: He shall not make himself unclean for his father or for his mother, for his brother or for his sister, when they die, because his separation to God is on his head.
speaker: Narrator

text: All the days of his separation he is holy to the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘But if a man dies very suddenly beside him and he defiles his dedicated head of hair, then he shall shave his head on the day when he becomes clean; he shall shave it on the seventh day.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then on the eighth day he shall bring two turtledoves or two young pigeons to the priest, to the doorway of the tent of meeting.
speaker: Narrator

text: The priest shall offer one for a sin offering and the other for a burnt offering, and make atonement for him concerning his sin because of the dead person. And that same day he shall consecrate his head,
speaker: Narrator

text: and shall dedicate to the Lord his days as a Nazirite, and shall bring a male lamb a year old for a guilt offering; but the former days will be void because his separation was defiled.
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘Now this is the law of the Nazirite when the days of his separation are fulfilled, he shall bring the offering to the doorway of the tent of meeting.
speaker: Narrator

text: He shall present his offering to the Lord: one male lamb a year old without defect for a burnt offering and one ewe-lamb a year old without defect for a sin offering and one ram without defect for a peace offering,
speaker: Narrator

text: and a basket of unleavened cakes of fine flour mixed with oil and unleavened wafers spread with oil, along with their grain offering and their drink offering.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the priest shall present them before the Lord and shall offer his sin offering and his burnt offering.
speaker: Narrator

text: He shall also offer the ram for a sacrifice of peace offerings to the Lord, together with the basket of unleavened cakes; the priest shall likewise offer its grain offering and its drink offering.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Nazirite shall then shave his dedicated head of hair at the doorway of the tent of meeting, and take the dedicated hair of his head and put it on the fire which is under the sacrifice of peace offerings.
speaker: Narrator

text: The priest shall take the ram’s shoulder when it has been boiled, and one unleavened cake out of the basket and one unleavened wafer, and shall put them on the hands of the Nazirite after he has shaved his dedicated hair.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the priest shall wave them for a wave offering before the Lord. It is holy for the priest, together with the breast offered by waving and the thigh offered by lifting up; and afterward the Nazirite may drink wine.’
speaker: Narrator

text: “This is the law of the Nazirite who vows his offering to the Lord according to his separation, in addition to what else he can afford; according to his vow which he takes, so he shall do according to the law of his separation.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Lord spoke to Moses, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Speak to Aaron and to his sons, saying, ‘Thus you shall bless the sons of Israel. You shall say to them:
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord bless you, and keep you;
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord make His face shine on you,
And be gracious to you;
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord lift up His countenance on you,
And give you peace.’
speaker: Narrator

text: So they shall invoke My name on the sons of Israel, and I then will bless them.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Now on the day that Moses had finished setting up the tabernacle, he anointed it and consecrated it with all its furnishings and the altar and all its utensils; he anointed them and consecrated them also.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the leaders of Israel, the heads of their fathers’ households, made an offering (they were the leaders of the tribes; they were the ones who were over the numbered men).
speaker: Narrator

text: When they brought their offering before the Lord, six covered carts and twelve oxen, a cart for every two of the leaders and an ox for each one, then they presented them before the tabernacle.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Lord spoke to Moses, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Accept these things from them, that they may be used in the service of the tent of meeting, and you shall give them to the Levites, to each man according to his service.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Moses took the carts and the oxen and gave them to the Levites.
speaker: Narrator

text: Two carts and four oxen he gave to the sons of Gershon, according to their service,
speaker: Narrator

text: and four carts and eight oxen he gave to the sons of Merari, according to their service, under the direction of Ithamar the son of Aaron the priest.
speaker: Narrator

text: But he did not give any to the sons of Kohath because theirs was the service of the holy objects, which they carried on the shoulder.
speaker: Narrator

text: The leaders offered the dedication offering for the altar when it was anointed, so the leaders offered their offering before the altar.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Lord said to Moses, “Let them present their offering, one leader each day, for the dedication of the altar.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the one who presented his offering on the first day was Nahshon the son of Amminadab, of the tribe of Judah;
speaker: Narrator

text: and his offering was one silver dish whose weight was one hundred and thirty shekels, one silver bowl of seventy shekels, according to the shekel of the sanctuary, both of them full of fine flour mixed with oil for a grain offering;
speaker: Narrator

text: one gold pan of ten shekels, full of incense;
speaker: Narrator

text: one bull, one ram, one male lamb one year old, for a burnt offering;
speaker: Narrator

text: one male goat for a sin offering;
speaker: Narrator

text: and for the sacrifice of peace offerings, two oxen, five rams, five male goats, five male lambs one year old. This was the offering of Nahshon the son of Amminadab.
speaker: Narrator

text: This was the dedication offering for the altar from the leaders of Israel when it was anointed: twelve silver dishes, twelve silver bowls, twelve gold pans,
speaker: Narrator

text: each silver dish weighing one hundred and thirty shekels and each bowl seventy; all the silver of the utensils was 2,400 shekels, according to the shekel of the sanctuary;
speaker: Narrator

text: the twelve gold pans, full of incense, weighing ten shekels apiece, according to the shekel of the sanctuary, all the gold of the pans 120 shekels;
speaker: Narrator

text: all the oxen for the burnt offering twelve bulls, all the rams twelve, the male lambs one year old with their grain offering twelve, and the male goats for a sin offering twelve;
speaker: Narrator

text: and all the oxen for the sacrifice of peace offerings 24 bulls, all the rams 60, the male goats 60, the male lambs one year old 60. This was the dedication offering for the altar after it was anointed.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now when Moses went into the tent of meeting to speak with Him, he heard the voice speaking to him from above the mercy seat that was on the ark of the testimony, from between the two cherubim, so He spoke to him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Lord spoke to Moses, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Speak to Aaron and say to him, ‘When you mount the lamps, the seven lamps will give light in the front of the lampstand.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: Aaron therefore did so; he mounted its lamps at the front of the lampstand, just as the Lord had commanded Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now this was the workmanship of the lampstand, hammered work of gold; from its base to its flowers it was hammered work; according to the pattern which the Lord had shown Moses, so he made the lampstand.
speaker: Narrator

text: Again the Lord spoke to Moses, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Take the Levites from among the sons of Israel and cleanse them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus you shall do to them, for their cleansing: sprinkle purifying water on them, and let them use a razor over their whole body and wash their clothes, and they will be clean.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then let them take a bull with its grain offering, fine flour mixed with oil; and a second bull you shall take for a sin offering.
speaker: Narrator

text: So you shall present the Levites before the tent of meeting. You shall also assemble the whole congregation of the sons of Israel,
speaker: Narrator

text: and present the Levites before the Lord; and the sons of Israel shall lay their hands on the Levites.
speaker: Narrator

text: Aaron then shall present the Levites before the Lord as a wave offering from the sons of Israel, that they may qualify to perform the service of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the Levites shall lay their hands on the heads of the bulls; then offer the one for a sin offering and the other for a burnt offering to the Lord, to make atonement for the Levites.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall have the Levites stand before Aaron and before his sons so as to present them as a wave offering to the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Thus you shall separate the Levites from among the sons of Israel, and the Levites shall be Mine.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then after that the Levites may go in to serve the tent of meeting. But you shall cleanse them and present them as a wave offering;
speaker: Narrator

text: for they are wholly given to Me from among the sons of Israel. I have taken them for Myself instead of every first issue of the womb, the firstborn of all the sons of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: For every firstborn among the sons of Israel is Mine, among the men and among the animals; on the day that I struck down all the firstborn in the land of Egypt I sanctified them for Myself.
speaker: Narrator

text: But I have taken the Levites instead of every firstborn among the sons of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have given the Levites as a gift to Aaron and to his sons from among the sons of Israel, to perform the service of the sons of Israel at the tent of meeting and to make atonement on behalf of the sons of Israel, so that there will be no plague among the sons of Israel by their coming near to the sanctuary.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus did Moses and Aaron and all the congregation of the sons of Israel to the Levites; according to all that the Lord had commanded Moses concerning the Levites, so the sons of Israel did to them.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Levites, too, purified themselves from sin and washed their clothes; and Aaron presented them as a wave offering before the Lord. Aaron also made atonement for them to cleanse them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then after that the Levites went in to perform their service in the tent of meeting before Aaron and before his sons; just as the Lord had commanded Moses concerning the Levites, so they did to them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the Lord spoke to Moses, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “This is what applies to the Levites: from twenty-five years old and upward they shall enter to perform service in the work of the tent of meeting.
speaker: Narrator

text: But at the age of fifty years they shall retire from service in the work and not work any more.
speaker: Narrator

text: They may, however, assist their brothers in the tent of meeting, to keep an obligation, but they themselves shall do no work. Thus you shall deal with the Levites concerning their obligations.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus the Lord spoke to Moses in the wilderness of Sinai, in the first month of the second year after they had come out of the land of Egypt, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Now, let the sons of Israel observe the Passover at its appointed time.
speaker: Narrator

text: On the fourteenth day of this month, at twilight, you shall observe it at its appointed time; you shall observe it according to all its statutes and according to all its ordinances.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Moses told the sons of Israel to observe the Passover.
speaker: Narrator

text: They observed the Passover in the first month, on the fourteenth day of the month, at twilight, in the wilderness of Sinai; according to all that the Lord had commanded Moses, so the sons of Israel did.
speaker: Narrator

text: But there were some men who were unclean because of the dead person, so that they could not observe Passover on that day; so they came before Moses and Aaron on that day.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those men said to him, “Though we are unclean because of the dead person, why are we restrained from presenting the offering of the Lord at its appointed time among the sons of Israel?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses therefore said to them, “Wait, and I will listen to what the Lord will command concerning you.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Lord spoke to Moses, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Speak to the sons of Israel, saying, ‘If any one of you or of your generations becomes unclean because of a dead person, or is on a distant journey, he may, however, observe the Passover to the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the second month on the fourteenth day at twilight, they shall observe it; they shall eat it with unleavened bread and bitter herbs.
speaker: Narrator

text: They shall leave none of it until morning, nor break a bone of it; according to all the statute of the Passover they shall observe it.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the man who is clean and is not on a journey, and yet neglects to observe the Passover, that person shall then be cut off from his people, for he did not present the offering of the Lord at its appointed time. That man will bear his sin.
speaker: Narrator

text: If an alien sojourns among you and observes the Passover to the Lord, according to the statute of the Passover and according to its ordinance, so he shall do; you shall have one statute, both for the alien and for the native of the land.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: Now on the day that the tabernacle was erected the cloud covered the tabernacle, the tent of the testimony, and in the evening it was like the appearance of fire over the tabernacle, until morning.
speaker: Narrator

text: So it was continuously; the cloud would cover it by day, and the appearance of fire by night.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whenever the cloud was lifted from over the tent, afterward the sons of Israel would then set out; and in the place where the cloud settled down, there the sons of Israel would camp.
speaker: Narrator

text: At the command of the Lord the sons of Israel would set out, and at the command of the Lord they would camp; as long as the cloud settled over the tabernacle, they remained camped.
speaker: Narrator

text: Even when the cloud lingered over the tabernacle for many days, the sons of Israel would keep the Lord’s charge and not set out.
speaker: Narrator

text: If sometimes the cloud remained a few days over the tabernacle, according to the command of the Lord they remained camped. Then according to the command of the Lord they set out.
speaker: Narrator

text: If sometimes the cloud remained from evening until morning, when the cloud was lifted in the morning, they would move out; or if it remained in the daytime and at night, whenever the cloud was lifted, they would set out.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whether it was two days or a month or a year that the cloud lingered over the tabernacle, staying above it, the sons of Israel remained camped and did not set out; but when it was lifted, they did set out.
speaker: Narrator

text: At the command of the Lord they camped, and at the command of the Lord they set out; they kept the Lord’s charge, according to the command of the Lord through Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord spoke further to Moses, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Make yourself two trumpets of silver, of hammered work you shall make them; and you shall use them for summoning the congregation and for having the camps set out.
speaker: Narrator

text: When both are blown, all the congregation shall gather themselves to you at the doorway of the tent of meeting.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yet if only one is blown, then the leaders, the heads of the divisions of Israel, shall assemble before you.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when you blow an alarm, the camps that are pitched on the east side shall set out.
speaker: Narrator

text: When you blow an alarm the second time, the camps that are pitched on the south side shall set out; an alarm is to be blown for them to set out.
speaker: Narrator

text: When convening the assembly, however, you shall blow without sounding an alarm.
speaker: Narrator

text: The priestly sons of Aaron, moreover, shall blow the trumpets; and this shall be for you a perpetual statute throughout your generations.
speaker: Narrator

text: When you go to war in your land against the adversary who attacks you, then you shall sound an alarm with the trumpets, that you may be remembered before the Lord your God, and be saved from your enemies.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also in the day of your gladness and in your appointed feasts, and on the first days of your months, you shall blow the trumpets over your burnt offerings, and over the sacrifices of your peace offerings; and they shall be as a reminder of you before your God. I am the Lord your God.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Now in the second year, in the second month, on the twentieth of the month, the cloud was lifted from over the tabernacle of the testimony;
speaker: Narrator

text: and the sons of Israel set out on their journeys from the wilderness of Sinai. Then the cloud settled down in the wilderness of Paran.
speaker: Narrator

text: So they moved out for the first time according to the commandment of the Lord through Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: The standard of the camp of the sons of Judah, according to their armies, set out first, with Nahshon the son of Amminadab, over its army,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Nethanel the son of Zuar, over the tribal army of the sons of Issachar;
speaker: Narrator

text: and Eliab the son of Helon over the tribal army of the sons of Zebulun.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the tabernacle was taken down; and the sons of Gershon and the sons of Merari, who were carrying the tabernacle, set out.
speaker: Narrator

text: Next the standard of the camp of Reuben, according to their armies, set out with Elizur the son of Shedeur, over its army,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Shelumiel the son of Zurishaddai over the tribal army of the sons of Simeon,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Eliasaph the son of Deuel was over the tribal army of the sons of Gad.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Kohathites set out, carrying the holy objects; and the tabernacle was set up before their arrival.
speaker: Narrator

text: Next the standard of the camp of the sons of Ephraim, according to their armies, was set out, with Elishama the son of Ammihud over its army,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Gamaliel the son of Pedahzur over the tribal army of the sons of Manasseh;
speaker: Narrator

text: and Abidan the son of Gideoni over the tribal army of the sons of Benjamin.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the standard of the camp of the sons of Dan, according to their armies, which formed the rear guard for all the camps, set out, with Ahiezer the son of Ammishaddai over its army,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Pagiel the son of Ochran over the tribal army of the sons of Asher;
speaker: Narrator

text: and Ahira the son of Enan over the tribal army of the sons of Naphtali.
speaker: Narrator

text: This was the order of march of the sons of Israel by their armies as they set out.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Moses said to Hobab the son of Reuel the Midianite, Moses’ father-in-law, “We are setting out to the place of which the Lord said, ‘I will give it to you’; come with us and we will do you good, for the Lord has promised good concerning Israel.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But he said to him, “I will not come, but rather will go to my own land and relatives.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he said, “Please do not leave us, inasmuch as you know where we should camp in the wilderness, and you will be as eyes for us.
speaker: Narrator

text: So it will be, if you go with us, that whatever good the Lord does for us, we will do for you.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus they set out from the mount of the Lord three days’ journey, with the ark of the covenant of the Lord journeying in front of them for the three days, to seek out a resting place for them.
speaker: Narrator

text: The cloud of the Lord was over them by day when they set out from the camp.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then it came about when the ark set out that Moses said,
“Rise up, O Lord!
And let Your enemies be scattered,
And let those who hate You flee before You.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
When it came to rest, he said,
“Return, O Lord,
To the myriad thousands of Israel.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the people became like those who complain of adversity in the hearing of the Lord; and when the Lord heard it, His anger was kindled, and the fire of the Lord burned among them and consumed some of the outskirts of the camp.
speaker: Narrator

text: The people therefore cried out to Moses, and Moses prayed to the Lord and the fire died out.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the name of that place was called Taberah, because the fire of the Lord burned among them.
speaker: Narrator

text: The rabble who were among them had greedy desires; and also the sons of Israel wept again and said, “Who will give us meat to eat?
speaker: Narrator

text: We remember the fish which we used to eat free in Egypt, the cucumbers and the melons and the leeks and the onions and the garlic,
speaker: Narrator

text: but now our appetite is gone. There is nothing at all to look at except this manna.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the manna was like coriander seed, and its appearance like that of bdellium.
speaker: Narrator

text: The people would go about and gather it and grind it between two millstones or beat it in the mortar, and boil it in the pot and make cakes with it; and its taste was as the taste of cakes baked with oil.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the dew fell on the camp at night, the manna would fall with it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now Moses heard the people weeping throughout their families, each man at the doorway of his tent; and the anger of the Lord was kindled greatly, and Moses was displeased.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Moses said to the Lord, “Why have You been so hard on Your servant? And why have I not found favor in Your sight, that You have laid the burden of all this people on me?
speaker: Narrator

text: Was it I who conceived all this people? Was it I who brought them forth, that You should say to me, ‘Carry them in your bosom as a nurse carries a nursing infant, to the land which You swore to their fathers’?
speaker: Narrator

text: Where am I to get meat to give to all this people? For they weep before me, saying, ‘Give us meat that we may eat!’
speaker: Narrator

text: I alone am not able to carry all this people, because it is too burdensome for me.
speaker: Narrator

text: So if You are going to deal thus with me, please kill me at once, if I have found favor in Your sight, and do not let me see my wretchedness.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord therefore said to Moses, “Gather for Me seventy men from the elders of Israel, whom you know to be the elders of the people and their officers and bring them to the tent of meeting, and let them take their stand there with you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then I will come down and speak with you there, and I will take of the Spirit who is upon you, and will put Him upon them; and they shall bear the burden of the people with you, so that you will not bear it all alone.
speaker: Narrator

text: Say to the people, ‘Consecrate yourselves for tomorrow, and you shall eat meat; for you have wept in the ears of the Lord, saying, “Oh that someone would give us meat to eat! For we were well-off in Egypt.” Therefore the Lord will give you meat and you shall eat.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall eat, not one day, nor two days, nor five days, nor ten days, nor twenty days,
speaker: Narrator

text: but a whole month, until it comes out of your nostrils and becomes loathsome to you; because you have rejected the Lord who is among you and have wept before Him, saying, “Why did we ever leave Egypt?”’”
speaker: Narrator

text: But Moses said, “The people, among whom I am, are 600,000 on foot; yet You have said, ‘I will give them meat, so that they may eat for a whole month.’
speaker: Narrator

text: Should flocks and herds be slaughtered for them, to be sufficient for them? Or should all the fish of the sea be gathered together for them, to be sufficient for them?”
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord said to Moses, “Is the Lord’s power limited? Now you shall see whether My word will come true for you or not.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Moses went out and told the people the words of the Lord. Also, he gathered seventy men of the elders of the people, and stationed them around the tent.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Lord came down in the cloud and spoke to him; and He took of the Spirit who was upon him and placed Him upon the seventy elders. And when the Spirit rested upon them, they prophesied. But they did not do it again.
speaker: Narrator

text: But two men had remained in the camp; the name of one was Eldad and the name of the other Medad. And the Spirit rested upon them (now they were among those who had been registered, but had not gone out to the tent), and they prophesied in the camp.
speaker: Narrator

text: So a young man ran and told Moses and said, “Eldad and Medad are prophesying in the camp.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Joshua the son of Nun, the attendant of Moses from his youth, said, “Moses, my lord, restrain them.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But Moses said to him, “Are you jealous for my sake? Would that all the Lord’s people were prophets, that the Lord would put His Spirit upon them!”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Moses returned to the camp, both he and the elders of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now there went forth a wind from the Lord and it brought quail from the sea, and let them fall beside the camp, about a day’s journey on this side and a day’s journey on the other side, all around the camp and about two cubits deep on the surface of the ground.
speaker: Narrator

text: The people spent all day and all night and all the next day, and gathered the quail (he who gathered least gathered ten homers) and they spread them out for themselves all around the camp.
speaker: Narrator

text: While the meat was still between their teeth, before it was chewed, the anger of the Lord was kindled against the people, and the Lord struck the people with a very severe plague.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the name of that place was called Kibroth-hattaavah, because there they buried the people who had been greedy.
speaker: Narrator

text: From Kibroth-hattaavah the people set out for Hazeroth, and they remained at Hazeroth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Miriam and Aaron spoke against Moses because of the Cushite woman whom he had married (for he had married a Cushite woman);
speaker: Narrator

text: and they said, “Has the Lord indeed spoken only through Moses? Has He not spoken through us as well?” And the Lord heard it.
speaker: Narrator

text: (Now the man Moses was very humble, more than any man who was on the face of the earth.)
speaker: Narrator

text: Suddenly the Lord said to Moses and Aaron and to Miriam, “You three come out to the tent of meeting.” So the three of them came out.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Lord came down in a pillar of cloud and stood at the doorway of the tent, and He called Aaron and Miriam. When they had both come forward,
speaker: Narrator

text:
He said,
“Hear now My words:
If there is a prophet among you,
I, the Lord, shall make Myself known to him in a vision.
I shall speak with him in a dream.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Not so, with My servant Moses,
He is faithful in all My household;
speaker: Narrator

text:
With him I speak mouth to mouth,
Even openly, and not in dark sayings,
And he beholds the form of the Lord.
Why then were you not afraid
To speak against My servant, against Moses?”
speaker: Narrator

text: So the anger of the Lord burned against them and He departed.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when the cloud had withdrawn from over the tent, behold, Miriam was leprous, as white as snow. As Aaron turned toward Miriam, behold, she was leprous.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Aaron said to Moses, “Oh, my lord, I beg you, do not account this sin to us, in which we have acted foolishly and in which we have sinned.
speaker: Narrator

text: Oh, do not let her be like one dead, whose flesh is half eaten away when he comes from his mother’s womb!”
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses cried out to the Lord, saying, “O God, heal her, I pray!”
speaker: Narrator

text: But the Lord said to Moses, “If her father had but spit in her face, would she not bear her shame for seven days? Let her be shut up for seven days outside the camp, and afterward she may be received again.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Miriam was shut up outside the camp for seven days, and the people did not move on until Miriam was received again.
speaker: Narrator

text: Afterward, however, the people moved out from Hazeroth and camped in the wilderness of Paran.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Lord spoke to Moses saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Send out for yourself men so that they may spy out the land of Canaan, which I am going to give to the sons of Israel; you shall send a man from each of their fathers’ tribes, every one a leader among them.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Moses sent them from the wilderness of Paran at the command of the Lord, all of them men who were heads of the sons of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: These then were their names: from the tribe of Reuben, Shammua the son of Zaccur;
speaker: Narrator

text: from the tribe of Simeon, Shaphat the son of Hori;
speaker: Narrator

text: from the tribe of Judah, Caleb the son of Jephunneh;
speaker: Narrator

text: from the tribe of Issachar, Igal the son of Joseph;
speaker: Narrator

text: from the tribe of Ephraim, Hoshea the son of Nun;
speaker: Narrator

text: from the tribe of Benjamin, Palti the son of Raphu;
speaker: Narrator

text: from the tribe of Zebulun, Gaddiel the son of Sodi;
speaker: Narrator

text: from the tribe of Joseph, from the tribe of Manasseh, Gaddi the son of Susi;
speaker: Narrator

text: from the tribe of Dan, Ammiel the son of Gemalli;
speaker: Narrator

text: from the tribe of Asher, Sethur the son of Michael;
speaker: Narrator

text: from the tribe of Naphtali, Nahbi the son of Vophsi;
speaker: Narrator

text: from the tribe of Gad, Geuel the son of Machi.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the names of the men whom Moses sent to spy out the land; but Moses called Hoshea the son of Nun, Joshua.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Moses sent them to spy out the land of Canaan, he said to them, “Go up there into the Negev; then go up into the hill country.
speaker: Narrator

text: See what the land is like, and whether the people who live in it are strong or weak, whether they are few or many.
speaker: Narrator

text: How is the land in which they live, is it good or bad? And how are the cities in which they live, are they like open camps or with fortifications?
speaker: Narrator

text: How is the land, is it fat or lean? Are there trees in it or not? Make an effort then to get some of the fruit of the land.” Now the time was the time of the first ripe grapes.
speaker: Narrator

text: So they went up and spied out the land from the wilderness of Zin as far as Rehob, at Lebo-hamath.
speaker: Narrator

text: When they had gone up into the Negev, they came to Hebron where Ahiman, Sheshai and Talmai, the descendants of Anak were. (Now Hebron was built seven years before Zoan in Egypt.)
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they came to the valley of Eshcol and from there cut down a branch with a single cluster of grapes; and they carried it on a pole between two men, with some of the pomegranates and the figs.
speaker: Narrator

text: That place was called the valley of Eshcol, because of the cluster which the sons of Israel cut down from there.
speaker: Narrator

text: When they returned from spying out the land, at the end of forty days,
speaker: Narrator

text: they proceeded to come to Moses and Aaron and to all the congregation of the sons of Israel in the wilderness of Paran, at Kadesh; and they brought back word to them and to all the congregation and showed them the fruit of the land.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus they told him, and said, “We went in to the land where you sent us; and it certainly does flow with milk and honey, and this is its fruit.
speaker: Narrator

text: Nevertheless, the people who live in the land are strong, and the cities are fortified and very large; and moreover, we saw the descendants of Anak there.
speaker: Narrator

text: Amalek is living in the land of the Negev and the Hittites and the Jebusites and the Amorites are living in the hill country, and the Canaanites are living by the sea and by the side of the Jordan.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Caleb quieted the people before Moses and said, “We should by all means go up and take possession of it, for we will surely overcome it.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But the men who had gone up with him said, “We are not able to go up against the people, for they are too strong for us.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So they gave out to the sons of Israel a bad report of the land which they had spied out, saying, “The land through which we have gone, in spying it out, is a land that devours its inhabitants; and all the people whom we saw in it are men of great size.
speaker: Narrator

text: There also we saw the Nephilim (the sons of Anak are part of the Nephilim); and we became like grasshoppers in our own sight, and so we were in their sight.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then all the congregation lifted up their voices and cried, and the people wept that night.
speaker: Narrator

text: All the sons of Israel grumbled against Moses and Aaron; and the whole congregation said to them, “Would that we had died in the land of Egypt! Or would that we had died in this wilderness!
speaker: Narrator

text: Why is the Lord bringing us into this land, to fall by the sword? Our wives and our little ones will become plunder; would it not be better for us to return to Egypt?”
speaker: Narrator

text: So they said to one another, “Let us appoint a leader and return to Egypt.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Moses and Aaron fell on their faces in the presence of all the assembly of the congregation of the sons of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Joshua the son of Nun and Caleb the son of Jephunneh, of those who had spied out the land, tore their clothes;
speaker: Narrator

text: and they spoke to all the congregation of the sons of Israel, saying, “The land which we passed through to spy out is an exceedingly good land.
speaker: Narrator

text: If the Lord is pleased with us, then He will bring us into this land and give it to us—a land which flows with milk and honey.
speaker: Narrator

text: Only do not rebel against the Lord; and do not fear the people of the land, for they will be our prey. Their protection has been removed from them, and the Lord is with us; do not fear them.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But all the congregation said to stone them with stones. Then the glory of the Lord appeared in the tent of meeting to all the sons of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord said to Moses, “How long will this people spurn Me? And how long will they not believe in Me, despite all the signs which I have performed in their midst?
speaker: Narrator

text: I will smite them with pestilence and dispossess them, and I will make you into a nation greater and mightier than they.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But Moses said to the Lord, “Then the Egyptians will hear of it, for by Your strength You brought up this people from their midst,
speaker: Narrator

text: and they will tell it to the inhabitants of this land. They have heard that You, O Lord, are in the midst of this people, for You, O Lord, are seen eye to eye, while Your cloud stands over them; and You go before them in a pillar of cloud by day and in a pillar of fire by night.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now if You slay this people as one man, then the nations who have heard of Your fame will say,
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘Because the Lord could not bring this people into the land which He promised them by oath, therefore He slaughtered them in the wilderness.’
speaker: Narrator

text: But now, I pray, let the power of the Lord be great, just as You have declared,
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘The Lord is slow to anger and abundant in lovingkindness, forgiving iniquity and transgression; but He will by no means clear the guilty, visiting the iniquity of the fathers on the children to the third and the fourth generations.’
speaker: Narrator

text: Pardon, I pray, the iniquity of this people according to the greatness of Your lovingkindness, just as You also have forgiven this people, from Egypt even until now.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So the Lord said, “I have pardoned them according to your word;
speaker: Narrator

text: but indeed, as I live, all the earth will be filled with the glory of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Surely all the men who have seen My glory and My signs which I performed in Egypt and in the wilderness, yet have put Me to the test these ten times and have not listened to My voice,
speaker: Narrator

text: shall by no means see the land which I swore to their fathers, nor shall any of those who spurned Me see it.
speaker: Narrator

text: But My servant Caleb, because he has had a different spirit and has followed Me fully, I will bring into the land which he entered, and his descendants shall take possession of it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the Amalekites and the Canaanites live in the valleys; turn tomorrow and set out to the wilderness by the way of the Red Sea.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord spoke to Moses and Aaron, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “How long shall I bear with this evil congregation who are grumbling against Me? I have heard the complaints of the sons of Israel, which they are making against Me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Say to them, ‘As I live,’ says the Lord, ‘just as you have spoken in My hearing, so I will surely do to you;
speaker: Narrator

text: your corpses will fall in this wilderness, even all your numbered men, according to your complete number from twenty years old and upward, who have grumbled against Me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Surely you shall not come into the land in which I swore to settle you, except Caleb the son of Jephunneh and Joshua the son of Nun.
speaker: Narrator

text: Your children, however, whom you said would become a prey—I will bring them in, and they will know the land which you have rejected.
speaker: Narrator

text: But as for you, your corpses will fall in this wilderness.
speaker: Narrator

text: Your sons shall be shepherds for forty years in the wilderness, and they will suffer for your unfaithfulness, until your corpses lie in the wilderness.
speaker: Narrator

text: According to the number of days which you spied out the land, forty days, for every day you shall bear your guilt a year, even forty years, and you will know My opposition.
speaker: Narrator

text: I, the Lord, have spoken, surely this I will do to all this evil congregation who are gathered together against Me. In this wilderness they shall be destroyed, and there they will die.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: As for the men whom Moses sent to spy out the land and who returned and made all the congregation grumble against him by bringing out a bad report concerning the land,
speaker: Narrator

text: even those men who brought out the very bad report of the land died by a plague before the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Joshua the son of Nun and Caleb the son of Jephunneh remained alive out of those men who went to spy out the land.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Moses spoke these words to all the sons of Israel, the people mourned greatly.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the morning, however, they rose up early and went up to the ridge of the hill country, saying, “Here we are; we have indeed sinned, but we will go up to the place which the Lord has promised.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But Moses said, “Why then are you transgressing the commandment of the Lord, when it will not succeed?
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not go up, or you will be struck down before your enemies, for the Lord is not among you.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the Amalekites and the Canaanites will be there in front of you, and you will fall by the sword, inasmuch as you have turned back from following the Lord. And the Lord will not be with you.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But they went up heedlessly to the ridge of the hill country; neither the ark of the covenant of the Lord nor Moses left the camp.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Amalekites and the Canaanites who lived in that hill country came down, and struck them and beat them down as far as Hormah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the Lord spoke to Moses, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Speak to the sons of Israel and say to them, ‘When you enter the land where you are to live, which I am giving you,
speaker: Narrator

text: then make an offering by fire to the Lord, a burnt offering or a sacrifice to fulfill a special vow, or as a freewill offering or in your appointed times, to make a soothing aroma to the Lord, from the herd or from the flock.
speaker: Narrator

text: The one who presents his offering shall present to the Lord a grain offering of one-tenth of an ephah of fine flour mixed with one-fourth of a hin of oil,
speaker: Narrator

text: and you shall prepare wine for the drink offering, one-fourth of a hin, with the burnt offering or for the sacrifice, for each lamb.
speaker: Narrator

text: Or for a ram you shall prepare as a grain offering two-tenths of an ephah of fine flour mixed with one-third of a hin of oil;
speaker: Narrator

text: and for the drink offering you shall offer one-third of a hin of wine as a soothing aroma to the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: When you prepare a bull as a burnt offering or a sacrifice, to fulfill a special vow, or for peace offerings to the Lord,
speaker: Narrator

text: then you shall offer with the bull a grain offering of three-tenths of an ephah of fine flour mixed with one-half a hin of oil;
speaker: Narrator

text: and you shall offer as the drink offering one-half a hin of wine as an offering by fire, as a soothing aroma to the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘Thus it shall be done for each ox, or for each ram, or for each of the male lambs, or of the goats.
speaker: Narrator

text: According to the number that you prepare, so you shall do for everyone according to their number.
speaker: Narrator

text: All who are native shall do these things in this manner, in presenting an offering by fire, as a soothing aroma to the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: If an alien sojourns with you, or one who may be among you throughout your generations, and he wishes to make an offering by fire, as a soothing aroma to the Lord, just as you do so he shall do.
speaker: Narrator

text: As for the assembly, there shall be one statute for you and for the alien who sojourns with you, a perpetual statute throughout your generations; as you are, so shall the alien be before the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: There is to be one law and one ordinance for you and for the alien who sojourns with you.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Lord spoke to Moses, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Speak to the sons of Israel and say to them, ‘When you enter the land where I bring you,
speaker: Narrator

text: then it shall be, that when you eat of the food of the land, you shall lift up an offering to the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of the first of your dough you shall lift up a cake as an offering; as the offering of the threshing floor, so you shall lift it up.
speaker: Narrator

text: From the first of your dough you shall give to the Lord an offering throughout your generations.
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘But when you unwittingly fail and do not observe all these commandments, which the Lord has spoken to Moses,
speaker: Narrator

text: even all that the Lord has commanded you through Moses, from the day when the Lord gave commandment and onward throughout your generations,
speaker: Narrator

text: then it shall be, if it is done unintentionally, without the knowledge of the congregation, that all the congregation shall offer one bull for a burnt offering, as a soothing aroma to the Lord, with its grain offering and its drink offering, according to the ordinance, and one male goat for a sin offering.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the priest shall make atonement for all the congregation of the sons of Israel, and they will be forgiven; for it was an error, and they have brought their offering, an offering by fire to the Lord, and their sin offering before the Lord, for their error.
speaker: Narrator

text: So all the congregation of the sons of Israel will be forgiven, with the alien who sojourns among them, for it happened to all the people through error.
speaker: Narrator
