text: ‘Also if one person sins unintentionally, then he shall offer a one year old female goat for a sin offering.
speaker: Narrator

text: The priest shall make atonement before the Lord for the person who goes astray when he sins unintentionally, making atonement for him that he may be forgiven.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall have one law for him who does anything unintentionally, for him who is native among the sons of Israel and for the alien who sojourns among them.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the person who does anything defiantly, whether he is native or an alien, that one is blaspheming the Lord; and that person shall be cut off from among his people.
speaker: Narrator

text: Because he has despised the word of the Lord and has broken His commandment, that person shall be completely cut off; his guilt will be on him.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: Now while the sons of Israel were in the wilderness, they found a man gathering wood on the sabbath day.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those who found him gathering wood brought him to Moses and Aaron and to all the congregation;
speaker: Narrator

text: and they put him in custody because it had not been declared what should be done to him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Lord said to Moses, “The man shall surely be put to death; all the congregation shall stone him with stones outside the camp.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So all the congregation brought him outside the camp and stoned him to death with stones, just as the Lord had commanded Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord also spoke to Moses, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Speak to the sons of Israel, and tell them that they shall make for themselves tassels on the corners of their garments throughout their generations, and that they shall put on the tassel of each corner a cord of blue.
speaker: Narrator

text: It shall be a tassel for you to look at and remember all the commandments of the Lord, so as to do them and not follow after your own heart and your own eyes, after which you played the harlot,
speaker: Narrator

text: so that you may remember to do all My commandments and be holy to your God.
speaker: Narrator

text: I am the Lord your God who brought you out from the land of Egypt to be your God; I am the Lord your God.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Now Korah the son of Izhar, the son of Kohath, the son of Levi, with Dathan and Abiram, the sons of Eliab, and On the son of Peleth, sons of Reuben, took action,
speaker: Narrator

text: and they rose up before Moses, together with some of the sons of Israel, two hundred and fifty leaders of the congregation, chosen in the assembly, men of renown.
speaker: Narrator

text: They assembled together against Moses and Aaron, and said to them, “You have gone far enough, for all the congregation are holy, every one of them, and the Lord is in their midst; so why do you exalt yourselves above the assembly of the Lord?”
speaker: Narrator

text: When Moses heard this, he fell on his face;
speaker: Narrator

text: and he spoke to Korah and all his company, saying, “Tomorrow morning the Lord will show who is His, and who is holy, and will bring him near to Himself; even the one whom He will choose, He will bring near to Himself.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do this: take censers for yourselves, Korah and all your company,
speaker: Narrator

text: and put fire in them, and lay incense upon them in the presence of the Lord tomorrow; and the man whom the Lord chooses shall be the one who is holy. You have gone far enough, you sons of Levi!”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Moses said to Korah, “Hear now, you sons of Levi,
speaker: Narrator

text: is it not enough for you that the God of Israel has separated you from the rest of the congregation of Israel, to bring you near to Himself, to do the service of the tabernacle of the Lord, and to stand before the congregation to minister to them;
speaker: Narrator

text: and that He has brought you near, Korah, and all your brothers, sons of Levi, with you? And are you seeking for the priesthood also?
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore you and all your company are gathered together against the Lord; but as for Aaron, who is he that you grumble against him?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Moses sent a summons to Dathan and Abiram, the sons of Eliab; but they said, “We will not come up.
speaker: Narrator

text: Is it not enough that you have brought us up out of a land flowing with milk and honey to have us die in the wilderness, but you would also lord it over us?
speaker: Narrator

text: Indeed, you have not brought us into a land flowing with milk and honey, nor have you given us an inheritance of fields and vineyards. Would you put out the eyes of these men? We will not come up!”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Moses became very angry and said to the Lord, “Do not regard their offering! I have not taken a single donkey from them, nor have I done harm to any of them.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses said to Korah, “You and all your company be present before the Lord tomorrow, both you and they along with Aaron.
speaker: Narrator

text: Each of you take his firepan and put incense on it, and each of you bring his censer before the Lord, two hundred and fifty firepans; also you and Aaron shall each bring his firepan.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So they each took his own censer and put fire on it, and laid incense on it; and they stood at the doorway of the tent of meeting, with Moses and Aaron.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus Korah assembled all the congregation against them at the doorway of the tent of meeting. And the glory of the Lord appeared to all the congregation.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Lord spoke to Moses and Aaron, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Separate yourselves from among this congregation, that I may consume them instantly.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But they fell on their faces and said, “O God, God of the spirits of all flesh, when one man sins, will You be angry with the entire congregation?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Lord spoke to Moses, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Speak to the congregation, saying, ‘Get back from around the dwellings of Korah, Dathan and Abiram.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Moses arose and went to Dathan and Abiram, with the elders of Israel following him,
speaker: Narrator

text: and he spoke to the congregation, saying, “Depart now from the tents of these wicked men, and touch nothing that belongs to them, or you will be swept away in all their sin.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So they got back from around the dwellings of Korah, Dathan and Abiram; and Dathan and Abiram came out and stood at the doorway of their tents, along with their wives and their sons and their little ones.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses said, “By this you shall know that the Lord has sent me to do all these deeds; for this is not my doing.
speaker: Narrator

text: If these men die the death of all men or if they suffer the fate of all men, then the Lord has not sent me.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if the Lord brings about an entirely new thing and the ground opens its mouth and swallows them up with all that is theirs, and they descend alive into Sheol, then you will understand that these men have spurned the Lord.”
speaker: Narrator

text: As he finished speaking all these words, the ground that was under them split open;
speaker: Narrator

text: and the earth opened its mouth and swallowed them up, and their households, and all the men who belonged to Korah with their possessions.
speaker: Narrator

text: So they and all that belonged to them went down alive to Sheol; and the earth closed over them, and they perished from the midst of the assembly.
speaker: Narrator

text: All Israel who were around them fled at their outcry, for they said, “The earth may swallow us up!”
speaker: Narrator

text: Fire also came forth from the Lord and consumed the two hundred and fifty men who were offering the incense.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Lord spoke to Moses, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Say to Eleazar, the son of Aaron the priest, that he shall take up the censers out of the midst of the blaze, for they are holy; and you scatter the burning coals abroad.
speaker: Narrator

text: As for the censers of these men who have sinned at the cost of their lives, let them be made into hammered sheets for a plating of the altar, since they did present them before the Lord and they are holy; and they shall be for a sign to the sons of Israel.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Eleazar the priest took the bronze censers which the men who were burned had offered, and they hammered them out as a plating for the altar,
speaker: Narrator

text: as a reminder to the sons of Israel that no layman who is not of the descendants of Aaron should come near to burn incense before the Lord; so that he will not become like Korah and his company—just as the Lord had spoken to him through Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: But on the next day all the congregation of the sons of Israel grumbled against Moses and Aaron, saying, “You are the ones who have caused the death of the Lord’s people.”
speaker: Narrator

text: It came about, however, when the congregation had assembled against Moses and Aaron, that they turned toward the tent of meeting, and behold, the cloud covered it and the glory of the Lord appeared.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Moses and Aaron came to the front of the tent of meeting,
speaker: Narrator

text: and the Lord spoke to Moses, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Get away from among this congregation, that I may consume them instantly.” Then they fell on their faces.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses said to Aaron, “Take your censer and put in it fire from the altar, and lay incense on it; then bring it quickly to the congregation and make atonement for them, for wrath has gone forth from the Lord, the plague has begun!”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Aaron took it as Moses had spoken, and ran into the midst of the assembly, for behold, the plague had begun among the people. So he put on the incense and made atonement for the people.
speaker: Narrator

text: He took his stand between the dead and the living, so that the plague was checked.
speaker: Narrator

text: But those who died by the plague were 14,700, besides those who died on account of Korah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Aaron returned to Moses at the doorway of the tent of meeting, for the plague had been checked.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Lord spoke to Moses, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Speak to the sons of Israel, and get from them a rod for each father’s household: twelve rods, from all their leaders according to their fathers’ households. You shall write each name on his rod,
speaker: Narrator

text: and write Aaron’s name on the rod of Levi; for there is one rod for the head of each of their fathers’ households.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall then deposit them in the tent of meeting in front of the testimony, where I meet with you.
speaker: Narrator

text: It will come about that the rod of the man whom I choose will sprout. Thus I will lessen from upon Myself the grumblings of the sons of Israel, who are grumbling against you.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses therefore spoke to the sons of Israel, and all their leaders gave him a rod apiece, for each leader according to their fathers’ households, twelve rods, with the rod of Aaron among their rods.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Moses deposited the rods before the Lord in the tent of the testimony.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now on the next day Moses went into the tent of the testimony; and behold, the rod of Aaron for the house of Levi had sprouted and put forth buds and produced blossoms, and it bore ripe almonds.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses then brought out all the rods from the presence of the Lord to all the sons of Israel; and they looked, and each man took his rod.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the Lord said to Moses, “Put back the rod of Aaron before the testimony to be kept as a sign against the rebels, that you may put an end to their grumblings against Me, so that they will not die.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus Moses did; just as the Lord had commanded him, so he did.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the sons of Israel spoke to Moses, saying, “Behold, we perish, we are dying, we are all dying!
speaker: Narrator

text: Everyone who comes near, who comes near to the tabernacle of the Lord, must die. Are we to perish completely?”
speaker: Narrator

text: So the Lord said to Aaron, “You and your sons and your father’s household with you shall bear the guilt in connection with the sanctuary, and you and your sons with you shall bear the guilt in connection with your priesthood.
speaker: Narrator

text: But bring with you also your brothers, the tribe of Levi, the tribe of your father, that they may be joined with you and serve you, while you and your sons with you are before the tent of the testimony.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they shall thus attend to your obligation and the obligation of all the tent, but they shall not come near to the furnishings of the sanctuary and the altar, or both they and you will die.
speaker: Narrator

text: They shall be joined with you and attend to the obligations of the tent of meeting, for all the service of the tent; but an outsider may not come near you.
speaker: Narrator

text: So you shall attend to the obligations of the sanctuary and the obligations of the altar, so that there will no longer be wrath on the sons of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, I Myself have taken your fellow Levites from among the sons of Israel; they are a gift to you, dedicated to the Lord, to perform the service for the tent of meeting.
speaker: Narrator

text: But you and your sons with you shall attend to your priesthood for everything concerning the altar and inside the veil, and you are to perform service. I am giving you the priesthood as a bestowed service, but the outsider who comes near shall be put to death.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Lord spoke to Aaron, “Now behold, I Myself have given you charge of My offerings, even all the holy gifts of the sons of Israel I have given them to you as a portion and to your sons as a perpetual allotment.
speaker: Narrator

text: This shall be yours from the most holy gifts reserved from the fire; every offering of theirs, even every grain offering and every sin offering and every guilt offering, which they shall render to Me, shall be most holy for you and for your sons.
speaker: Narrator

text: As the most holy gifts you shall eat it; every male shall eat it. It shall be holy to you.
speaker: Narrator

text: This also is yours, the offering of their gift, even all the wave offerings of the sons of Israel; I have given them to you and to your sons and daughters with you as a perpetual allotment. Everyone of your household who is clean may eat it.
speaker: Narrator

text: All the best of the fresh oil and all the best of the fresh wine and of the grain, the first fruits of those which they give to the Lord, I give them to you.
speaker: Narrator

text: The first ripe fruits of all that is in their land, which they bring to the Lord, shall be yours; everyone of your household who is clean may eat it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Every devoted thing in Israel shall be yours.
speaker: Narrator

text: Every first issue of the womb of all flesh, whether man or animal, which they offer to the Lord, shall be yours; nevertheless the firstborn of man you shall surely redeem, and the firstborn of unclean animals you shall redeem.
speaker: Narrator

text: As to their redemption price, from a month old you shall redeem them, by your valuation, five shekels in silver, according to the shekel of the sanctuary, which is twenty gerahs.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the firstborn of an ox or the firstborn of a sheep or the firstborn of a goat, you shall not redeem; they are holy. You shall sprinkle their blood on the altar and shall offer up their fat in smoke as an offering by fire, for a soothing aroma to the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their meat shall be yours; it shall be yours like the breast of a wave offering and like the right thigh.
speaker: Narrator

text: All the offerings of the holy gifts, which the sons of Israel offer to the Lord, I have given to you and your sons and your daughters with you, as a perpetual allotment. It is an everlasting covenant of salt before the Lord to you and your descendants with you.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Lord said to Aaron, “You shall have no inheritance in their land nor own any portion among them; I am your portion and your inheritance among the sons of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: “To the sons of Levi, behold, I have given all the tithe in Israel for an inheritance, in return for their service which they perform, the service of the tent of meeting.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Israel shall not come near the tent of meeting again, or they will bear sin and die.
speaker: Narrator

text: Only the Levites shall perform the service of the tent of meeting, and they shall bear their iniquity; it shall be a perpetual statute throughout your generations, and among the sons of Israel they shall have no inheritance.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the tithe of the sons of Israel, which they offer as an offering to the Lord, I have given to the Levites for an inheritance; therefore I have said concerning them, ‘They shall have no inheritance among the sons of Israel.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Lord spoke to Moses, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Moreover, you shall speak to the Levites and say to them, ‘When you take from the sons of Israel the tithe which I have given you from them for your inheritance, then you shall present an offering from it to the Lord, a tithe of the tithe.
speaker: Narrator

text: Your offering shall be reckoned to you as the grain from the threshing floor or the full produce from the wine vat.
speaker: Narrator

text: So you shall also present an offering to the Lord from your tithes, which you receive from the sons of Israel; and from it you shall give the Lord’s offering to Aaron the priest.
speaker: Narrator

text: Out of all your gifts you shall present every offering due to the Lord, from all the best of them, the sacred part from them.’
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall say to them, ‘When you have offered from it the best of it, then the rest shall be reckoned to the Levites as the product of the threshing floor, and as the product of the wine vat.
speaker: Narrator

text: You may eat it anywhere, you and your households, for it is your compensation in return for your service in the tent of meeting.
speaker: Narrator

text: You will bear no sin by reason of it when you have offered the best of it. But you shall not profane the sacred gifts of the sons of Israel, or you will die.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Lord spoke to Moses and Aaron, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “This is the statute of the law which the Lord has commanded, saying, ‘Speak to the sons of Israel that they bring you an unblemished red heifer in which is no defect and on which a yoke has never been placed.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall give it to Eleazar the priest, and it shall be brought outside the camp and be slaughtered in his presence.
speaker: Narrator

text: Next Eleazar the priest shall take some of its blood with his finger and sprinkle some of its blood toward the front of the tent of meeting seven times.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the heifer shall be burned in his sight; its hide and its flesh and its blood, with its refuse, shall be burned.
speaker: Narrator

text: The priest shall take cedar wood and hyssop and scarlet material and cast it into the midst of the burning heifer.
speaker: Narrator

text: The priest shall then wash his clothes and bathe his body in water, and afterward come into the camp, but the priest shall be unclean until evening.
speaker: Narrator

text: The one who burns it shall also wash his clothes in water and bathe his body in water, and shall be unclean until evening.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now a man who is clean shall gather up the ashes of the heifer and deposit them outside the camp in a clean place, and the congregation of the sons of Israel shall keep it as water to remove impurity; it is purification from sin.
speaker: Narrator

text: The one who gathers the ashes of the heifer shall wash his clothes and be unclean until evening; and it shall be a perpetual statute to the sons of Israel and to the alien who sojourns among them.
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘The one who touches the corpse of any person shall be unclean for seven days.
speaker: Narrator

text: That one shall purify himself from uncleanness with the water on the third day and on the seventh day, and then he will be clean; but if he does not purify himself on the third day and on the seventh day, he will not be clean.
speaker: Narrator

text: Anyone who touches a corpse, the body of a man who has died, and does not purify himself, defiles the tabernacle of the Lord; and that person shall be cut off from Israel. Because the water for impurity was not sprinkled on him, he shall be unclean; his uncleanness is still on him.
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘This is the law when a man dies in a tent: everyone who comes into the tent and everyone who is in the tent shall be unclean for seven days.
speaker: Narrator

text: Every open vessel, which has no covering tied down on it, shall be unclean.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also, anyone who in the open field touches one who has been slain with a sword or who has died naturally, or a human bone or a grave, shall be unclean for seven days.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then for the unclean person they shall take some of the ashes of the burnt purification from sin and flowing water shall be added to them in a vessel.
speaker: Narrator

text: A clean person shall take hyssop and dip it in the water, and sprinkle it on the tent and on all the furnishings and on the persons who were there, and on the one who touched the bone or the one slain or the one dying naturally or the grave.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the clean person shall sprinkle on the unclean on the third day and on the seventh day; and on the seventh day he shall purify him from uncleanness, and he shall wash his clothes and bathe himself in water and shall be clean by evening.
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘But the man who is unclean and does not purify himself from uncleanness, that person shall be cut off from the midst of the assembly, because he has defiled the sanctuary of the Lord; the water for impurity has not been sprinkled on him, he is unclean.
speaker: Narrator

text: So it shall be a perpetual statute for them. And he who sprinkles the water for impurity shall wash his clothes, and he who touches the water for impurity shall be unclean until evening.
speaker: Narrator

text: Furthermore, anything that the unclean person touches shall be unclean; and the person who touches it shall be unclean until evening.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the sons of Israel, the whole congregation, came to the wilderness of Zin in the first month; and the people stayed at Kadesh. Now Miriam died there and was buried there.
speaker: Narrator

text: There was no water for the congregation, and they assembled themselves against Moses and Aaron.
speaker: Narrator

text: The people thus contended with Moses and spoke, saying, “If only we had perished when our brothers perished before the Lord!
speaker: Narrator

text: Why then have you brought the Lord’s assembly into this wilderness, for us and our beasts to die here?
speaker: Narrator

text: Why have you made us come up from Egypt, to bring us in to this wretched place? It is not a place of grain or figs or vines or pomegranates, nor is there water to drink.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Moses and Aaron came in from the presence of the assembly to the doorway of the tent of meeting and fell on their faces. Then the glory of the Lord appeared to them;
speaker: Narrator

text: and the Lord spoke to Moses, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Take the rod; and you and your brother Aaron assemble the congregation and speak to the rock before their eyes, that it may yield its water. You shall thus bring forth water for them out of the rock and let the congregation and their beasts drink.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Moses took the rod from before the Lord, just as He had commanded him;
speaker: Narrator

text: and Moses and Aaron gathered the assembly before the rock. And he said to them, “Listen now, you rebels; shall we bring forth water for you out of this rock?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Moses lifted up his hand and struck the rock twice with his rod; and water came forth abundantly, and the congregation and their beasts drank.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the Lord said to Moses and Aaron, “Because you have not believed Me, to treat Me as holy in the sight of the sons of Israel, therefore you shall not bring this assembly into the land which I have given them.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Those were the waters of Meribah, because the sons of Israel contended with the Lord, and He proved Himself holy among them.
speaker: Narrator

text: From Kadesh Moses then sent messengers to the king of Edom: “Thus your brother Israel has said, ‘You know all the hardship that has befallen us;
speaker: Narrator

text: that our fathers went down to Egypt, and we stayed in Egypt a long time, and the Egyptians treated us and our fathers badly.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when we cried out to the Lord, He heard our voice and sent an angel and brought us out from Egypt; now behold, we are at Kadesh, a town on the edge of your territory.
speaker: Narrator

text: Please let us pass through your land. We will not pass through field or through vineyard; we will not even drink water from a well. We will go along the king’s highway, not turning to the right or left, until we pass through your territory.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: Edom, however, said to him, “You shall not pass through us, or I will come out with the sword against you.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Again, the sons of Israel said to him, “We will go up by the highway, and if I and my livestock do drink any of your water, then I will pay its price. Let me only pass through on my feet, nothing else.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But he said, “You shall not pass through.” And Edom came out against him with a heavy force and with a strong hand.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus Edom refused to allow Israel to pass through his territory; so Israel turned away from him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now when they set out from Kadesh, the sons of Israel, the whole congregation, came to Mount Hor.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Lord spoke to Moses and Aaron at Mount Hor by the border of the land of Edom, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Aaron will be gathered to his people; for he shall not enter the land which I have given to the sons of Israel, because you rebelled against My command at the waters of Meribah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Take Aaron and his son Eleazar and bring them up to Mount Hor;
speaker: Narrator

text: and strip Aaron of his garments and put them on his son Eleazar. So Aaron will be gathered to his people, and will die there.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Moses did just as the Lord had commanded, and they went up to Mount Hor in the sight of all the congregation.
speaker: Narrator

text: After Moses had stripped Aaron of his garments and put them on his son Eleazar, Aaron died there on the mountain top. Then Moses and Eleazar came down from the mountain.
speaker: Narrator

text: When all the congregation saw that Aaron had died, all the house of Israel wept for Aaron thirty days.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the Canaanite, the king of Arad, who lived in the Negev, heard that Israel was coming by the way of Atharim, then he fought against Israel and took some of them captive.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Israel made a vow to the Lord and said, “If You will indeed deliver this people into my hand, then I will utterly destroy their cities.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord heard the voice of Israel and delivered up the Canaanites; then they utterly destroyed them and their cities. Thus the name of the place was called Hormah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they set out from Mount Hor by the way of the Red Sea, to go around the land of Edom; and the people became impatient because of the journey.
speaker: Narrator

text: The people spoke against God and Moses, “Why have you brought us up out of Egypt to die in the wilderness? For there is no food and no water, and we loathe this miserable food.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord sent fiery serpents among the people and they bit the people, so that many people of Israel died.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the people came to Moses and said, “We have sinned, because we have spoken against the Lord and you; intercede with the Lord, that He may remove the serpents from us.” And Moses interceded for the people.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Lord said to Moses, “Make a fiery serpent, and set it on a standard; and it shall come about, that everyone who is bitten, when he looks at it, he will live.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And Moses made a bronze serpent and set it on the standard; and it came about, that if a serpent bit any man, when he looked to the bronze serpent, he lived.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the sons of Israel moved out and camped in Oboth.
speaker: Narrator

text: They journeyed from Oboth and camped at Iye-abarim, in the wilderness which is opposite Moab, to the east.
speaker: Narrator

text: From there they set out and camped in Wadi Zered.
speaker: Narrator

text: From there they journeyed and camped on the other side of the Arnon, which is in the wilderness that comes out of the border of the Amorites, for the Arnon is the border of Moab, between Moab and the Amorites.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Therefore it is said in the Book of the Wars of the Lord,
“Waheb in Suphah,
And the wadis of the Arnon,
speaker: Narrator

text:
And the slope of the wadis
That extends to the site of Ar,
And leans to the border of Moab.”
speaker: Narrator

text: From there they continued to Beer, that is the well where the Lord said to Moses, “Assemble the people, that I may give them water.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then Israel sang this song:
“Spring up, O well! Sing to it!
speaker: Narrator

text:
“The well, which the leaders sank,
Which the nobles of the people dug,
With the scepter and with their staffs.”
And from the wilderness they continued to Mattanah,
speaker: Narrator

text: and from Mattanah to Nahaliel, and from Nahaliel to Bamoth,
speaker: Narrator

text: and from Bamoth to the valley that is in the land of Moab, at the top of Pisgah which overlooks the wasteland.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Israel sent messengers to Sihon, king of the Amorites, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Let me pass through your land. We will not turn off into field or vineyard; we will not drink water from wells. We will go by the king’s highway until we have passed through your border.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But Sihon would not permit Israel to pass through his border. So Sihon gathered all his people and went out against Israel in the wilderness, and came to Jahaz and fought against Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Israel struck him with the edge of the sword, and took possession of his land from the Arnon to the Jabbok, as far as the sons of Ammon; for the border of the sons of Ammon was Jazer.
speaker: Narrator

text: Israel took all these cities and Israel lived in all the cities of the Amorites, in Heshbon, and in all her villages.
speaker: Narrator

text: For Heshbon was the city of Sihon, king of the Amorites, who had fought against the former king of Moab and had taken all his land out of his hand, as far as the Arnon.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Therefore those who use proverbs say,
“Come to Heshbon! Let it be built!
So let the city of Sihon be established.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“For a fire went forth from Heshbon,
A flame from the town of Sihon;
It devoured Ar of Moab,
The dominant heights of the Arnon.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Woe to you, O Moab!
You are ruined, O people of Chemosh!
He has given his sons as fugitives,
And his daughters into captivity,
To an Amorite king, Sihon.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“But we have cast them down,
Heshbon is ruined as far as Dibon,
Then we have laid waste even to Nophah,
Which reaches to Medeba.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus Israel lived in the land of the Amorites.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses sent to spy out Jazer, and they captured its villages and dispossessed the Amorites who were there.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they turned and went up by the way of Bashan, and Og the king of Bashan went out with all his people, for battle at Edrei.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the Lord said to Moses, “Do not fear him, for I have given him into your hand, and all his people and his land; and you shall do to him as you did to Sihon, king of the Amorites, who lived at Heshbon.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So they killed him and his sons and all his people, until there was no remnant left him; and they possessed his land.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the sons of Israel journeyed, and camped in the plains of Moab beyond the Jordan opposite Jericho.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now Balak the son of Zippor saw all that Israel had done to the Amorites.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Moab was in great fear because of the people, for they were numerous; and Moab was in dread of the sons of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moab said to the elders of Midian, “Now this horde will lick up all that is around us, as the ox licks up the grass of the field.” And Balak the son of Zippor was king of Moab at that time.
speaker: Narrator

text: So he sent messengers to Balaam the son of Beor, at Pethor, which is near the River, in the land of the sons of his people, to call him, saying, “Behold, a people came out of Egypt; behold, they cover the surface of the land, and they are living opposite me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now, therefore, please come, curse this people for me since they are too mighty for me; perhaps I may be able to defeat them and drive them out of the land. For I know that he whom you bless is blessed, and he whom you curse is cursed.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So the elders of Moab and the elders of Midian departed with the fees for divination in their hand; and they came to Balaam and repeated Balak’s words to him.
speaker: Narrator

text: He said to them, “Spend the night here, and I will bring word back to you as the Lord may speak to me.” And the leaders of Moab stayed with Balaam.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then God came to Balaam and said, “Who are these men with you?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Balaam said to God, “Balak the son of Zippor, king of Moab, has sent word to me,
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘Behold, there is a people who came out of Egypt and they cover the surface of the land; now come, curse them for me; perhaps I may be able to fight against them and drive them out.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: God said to Balaam, “Do not go with them; you shall not curse the people, for they are blessed.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Balaam arose in the morning and said to Balak’s leaders, “Go back to your land, for the Lord has refused to let me go with you.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The leaders of Moab arose and went to Balak and said, “Balaam refused to come with us.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Balak again sent leaders, more numerous and more distinguished than the former.
speaker: Narrator

text: They came to Balaam and said to him, “Thus says Balak the son of Zippor, ‘Let nothing, I beg you, hinder you from coming to me;
speaker: Narrator

text: for I will indeed honor you richly, and I will do whatever you say to me. Please come then, curse this people for me.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: Balaam replied to the servants of Balak, “Though Balak were to give me his house full of silver and gold, I could not do anything, either small or great, contrary to the command of the Lord my God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now please, you also stay here tonight, and I will find out what else the Lord will speak to me.”
speaker: Narrator

text: God came to Balaam at night and said to him, “If the men have come to call you, rise up and go with them; but only the word which I speak to you shall you do.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Balaam arose in the morning, and saddled his donkey and went with the leaders of Moab.
speaker: Narrator

text: But God was angry because he was going, and the angel of the Lord took his stand in the way as an adversary against him. Now he was riding on his donkey and his two servants were with him.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the donkey saw the angel of the Lord standing in the way with his drawn sword in his hand, the donkey turned off from the way and went into the field; but Balaam struck the donkey to turn her back into the way.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the angel of the Lord stood in a narrow path of the vineyards, with a wall on this side and a wall on that side.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the donkey saw the angel of the Lord, she pressed herself to the wall and pressed Balaam’s foot against the wall, so he struck her again.
speaker: Narrator

text: The angel of the Lord went further, and stood in a narrow place where there was no way to turn to the right hand or the left.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the donkey saw the angel of the Lord, she lay down under Balaam; so Balaam was angry and struck the donkey with his stick.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord opened the mouth of the donkey, and she said to Balaam, “What have I done to you, that you have struck me these three times?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Balaam said to the donkey, “Because you have made a mockery of me! If there had been a sword in my hand, I would have killed you by now.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The donkey said to Balaam, “Am I not your donkey on which you have ridden all your life to this day? Have I ever been accustomed to do so to you?” And he said, “No.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Lord opened the eyes of Balaam, and he saw the angel of the Lord standing in the way with his drawn sword in his hand; and he bowed all the way to the ground.
speaker: Narrator

text: The angel of the Lord said to him, “Why have you struck your donkey these three times? Behold, I have come out as an adversary, because your way was contrary to me.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the donkey saw me and turned aside from me these three times. If she had not turned aside from me, I would surely have killed you just now, and let her live.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Balaam said to the angel of the Lord, “I have sinned, for I did not know that you were standing in the way against me. Now then, if it is displeasing to you, I will turn back.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But the angel of the Lord said to Balaam, “Go with the men, but you shall speak only the word which I tell you.” So Balaam went along with the leaders of Balak.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Balak heard that Balaam was coming, he went out to meet him at the city of Moab, which is on the Arnon border, at the extreme end of the border.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Balak said to Balaam, “Did I not urgently send to you to call you? Why did you not come to me? Am I really unable to honor you?”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Balaam said to Balak, “Behold, I have come now to you! Am I able to speak anything at all? The word that God puts in my mouth, that I shall speak.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And Balaam went with Balak, and they came to Kiriath-huzoth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Balak sacrificed oxen and sheep, and sent some to Balaam and the leaders who were with him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then it came about in the morning that Balak took Balaam and brought him up to the high places of Baal, and he saw from there a portion of the people.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Balaam said to Balak, “Build seven altars for me here, and prepare seven bulls and seven rams for me here.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Balak did just as Balaam had spoken, and Balak and Balaam offered up a bull and a ram on each altar.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Balaam said to Balak, “Stand beside your burnt offering, and I will go; perhaps the Lord will come to meet me, and whatever He shows me I will tell you.” So he went to a bare hill.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now God met Balaam, and he said to Him, “I have set up the seven altars, and I have offered up a bull and a ram on each altar.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Lord put a word in Balaam’s mouth and said, “Return to Balak, and you shall speak thus.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So he returned to him, and behold, he was standing beside his burnt offering, he and all the leaders of Moab.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He took up his discourse and said,
“From Aram Balak has brought me,
Moab’s king from the mountains of the East,
‘Come curse Jacob for me,
And come, denounce Israel!’
speaker: Narrator

text:
“How shall I curse whom God has not cursed?
And how can I denounce whom the Lord has not denounced?
speaker: Narrator

text:
“As I see him from the top of the rocks,
And I look at him from the hills;
Behold, a people who dwells apart,
And will not be reckoned among the nations.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Who can count the dust of Jacob,
Or number the fourth part of Israel?
Let me die the death of the upright,
And let my end be like his!”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Balak said to Balaam, “What have you done to me? I took you to curse my enemies, but behold, you have actually blessed them!”
speaker: Narrator

text: He replied, “Must I not be careful to speak what the Lord puts in my mouth?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Balak said to him, “Please come with me to another place from where you may see them, although you will only see the extreme end of them and will not see all of them; and curse them for me from there.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So he took him to the field of Zophim, to the top of Pisgah, and built seven altars and offered a bull and a ram on each altar.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said to Balak, “Stand here beside your burnt offering while I myself meet the Lord over there.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Lord met Balaam and put a word in his mouth and said, “Return to Balak, and thus you shall speak.”
speaker: Narrator

text: He came to him, and behold, he was standing beside his burnt offering, and the leaders of Moab with him. And Balak said to him, “What has the Lord spoken?”
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
“God is not a man, that He should lie,
Nor a son of man, that He should repent;
Has He said, and will He not do it?
Or has He spoken, and will He not make it good?
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Behold, I have received a command to bless;
When He has blessed, then I cannot revoke it.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
“God brings them out of Egypt,
He is for them like the horns of the wild ox.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“For there is no omen against Jacob,
Nor is there any divination against Israel;
At the proper time it shall be said to Jacob
And to Israel, what God has done!
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Behold, a people rises like a lioness,
And as a lion it lifts itself;
It will not lie down until it devours the prey,
And drinks the blood of the slain.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Balak said to Balaam, “Do not curse them at all nor bless them at all!”
speaker: Narrator

text: But Balaam replied to Balak, “Did I not tell you, ‘Whatever the Lord speaks, that I must do’?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Balak said to Balaam, “Please come, I will take you to another place; perhaps it will be agreeable with God that you curse them for me from there.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Balak took Balaam to the top of Peor which overlooks the wasteland.
speaker: Narrator

text: Balaam said to Balak, “Build seven altars for me here and prepare seven bulls and seven rams for me here.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Balak did just as Balaam had said, and offered up a bull and a ram on each altar.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Balaam saw that it pleased the Lord to bless Israel, he did not go as at other times to seek omens but he set his face toward the wilderness.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Balaam lifted up his eyes and saw Israel camping tribe by tribe; and the Spirit of God came upon him.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
The oracle of him who hears the words of God,
Who sees the vision of the Almighty,
Falling down, yet having his eyes uncovered,
speaker: Narrator

text:
How fair are your tents, O Jacob,
Your dwellings, O Israel!
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Like valleys that stretch out,
Like gardens beside the river,
Like aloes planted by the Lord,
Like cedars beside the waters.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Water will flow from his buckets,
And his seed will be by many waters,
And his king shall be higher than Agag,
And his kingdom shall be exalted.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“God brings him out of Egypt,
He is for him like the horns of the wild ox.
He will devour the nations who are his adversaries,
And will crush their bones in pieces,
And shatter them with his arrows.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“He couches, he lies down as a lion,
And as a lion, who dares rouse him?
Blessed is everyone who blesses you,
And cursed is everyone who curses you.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Balak’s anger burned against Balaam, and he struck his hands together; and Balak said to Balaam, “I called you to curse my enemies, but behold, you have persisted in blessing them these three times!
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore, flee to your place now. I said I would honor you greatly, but behold, the Lord has held you back from honor.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Balaam said to Balak, “Did I not tell your messengers whom you had sent to me, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘Though Balak were to give me his house full of silver and gold, I could not do anything contrary to the command of the Lord, either good or bad, of my own accord. What the Lord speaks, that I will speak’?
speaker: Narrator

text: And now, behold, I am going to my people; come, and I will advise you what this people will do to your people in the days to come.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
He took up his discourse and said,
“The oracle of Balaam the son of Beor,
And the oracle of the man whose eye is opened,
speaker: Narrator

text:
The oracle of him who hears the words of God,
And knows the knowledge of the Most High,
Who sees the vision of the Almighty,
Falling down, yet having his eyes uncovered.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
“Edom shall be a possession,
Seir, its enemies, also will be a possession,
While Israel performs valiantly.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“One from Jacob shall have dominion,
And will destroy the remnant from the city.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
And he looked at Amalek and took up his discourse and said,
“Amalek was the first of the nations,
But his end shall be destruction.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
And he looked at the Kenite, and took up his discourse and said,
“Your dwelling place is enduring,
And your nest is set in the cliff.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Nevertheless Kain will be consumed;
How long will Asshur keep you captive?”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then he took up his discourse and said,
“Alas, who can live except God has ordained it?
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text: Then Balaam arose and departed and returned to his place, and Balak also went his way.
speaker: Narrator

text: While Israel remained at Shittim, the people began to play the harlot with the daughters of Moab.
speaker: Narrator

text: For they invited the people to the sacrifices of their gods, and the people ate and bowed down to their gods.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Israel joined themselves to Baal of Peor, and the Lord was angry against Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord said to Moses, “Take all the leaders of the people and execute them in broad daylight before the Lord, so that the fierce anger of the Lord may turn away from Israel.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Moses said to the judges of Israel, “Each of you slay his men who have joined themselves to Baal of Peor.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then behold, one of the sons of Israel came and brought to his relatives a Midianite woman, in the sight of Moses and in the sight of all the congregation of the sons of Israel, while they were weeping at the doorway of the tent of meeting.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Phinehas the son of Eleazar, the son of Aaron the priest, saw it, he arose from the midst of the congregation and took a spear in his hand,
speaker: Narrator

text: and he went after the man of Israel into the tent and pierced both of them through, the man of Israel and the woman, through the body. So the plague on the sons of Israel was checked.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those who died by the plague were 24,000.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Lord spoke to Moses, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Phinehas the son of Eleazar, the son of Aaron the priest, has turned away My wrath from the sons of Israel in that he was jealous with My jealousy among them, so that I did not destroy the sons of Israel in My jealousy.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore say, ‘Behold, I give him My covenant of peace;
speaker: Narrator

text: and it shall be for him and his descendants after him, a covenant of a perpetual priesthood, because he was jealous for his God and made atonement for the sons of Israel.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the name of the slain man of Israel who was slain with the Midianite woman, was Zimri the son of Salu, a leader of a father’s household among the Simeonites.
speaker: Narrator

text: The name of the Midianite woman who was slain was Cozbi the daughter of Zur, who was head of the people of a father’s household in Midian.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Lord spoke to Moses, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Be hostile to the Midianites and strike them;
speaker: Narrator

text: for they have been hostile to you with their tricks, with which they have deceived you in the affair of Peor and in the affair of Cozbi, the daughter of the leader of Midian, their sister who was slain on the day of the plague because of Peor.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then it came about after the plague, that the Lord spoke to Moses and to Eleazar the son of Aaron the priest, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Take a census of all the congregation of the sons of Israel from twenty years old and upward, by their fathers’ households, whoever is able to go out to war in Israel.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Moses and Eleazar the priest spoke with them in the plains of Moab by the Jordan at Jericho, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Take a census of the people from twenty years old and upward, as the Lord has commanded Moses.”
Now the sons of Israel who came out of the land of Egypt were:
speaker: Narrator

text: Reuben, Israel’s firstborn, the sons of Reuben: of Hanoch, the family of the Hanochites; of Pallu, the family of the Palluites;
speaker: Narrator

text: of Hezron, the family of the Hezronites; of Carmi, the family of the Carmites.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the families of the Reubenites, and those who were numbered of them were 43,730.
speaker: Narrator

text: The son of Pallu: Eliab.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Eliab: Nemuel and Dathan and Abiram. These are the Dathan and Abiram who were called by the congregation, who contended against Moses and against Aaron in the company of Korah, when they contended against the Lord,
speaker: Narrator

text: and the earth opened its mouth and swallowed them up along with Korah, when that company died, when the fire devoured 250 men, so that they became a warning.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Korah, however, did not die.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Simeon according to their families: of Nemuel, the family of the Nemuelites; of Jamin, the family of the Jaminites; of Jachin, the family of the Jachinites;
speaker: Narrator

text: of Zerah, the family of the Zerahites; of Shaul, the family of the Shaulites.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the families of the Simeonites, 22,200.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Gad according to their families: of Zephon, the family of the Zephonites; of Haggi, the family of the Haggites; of Shuni, the family of the Shunites;
speaker: Narrator

text: of Ozni, the family of the Oznites; of Eri, the family of the Erites;
speaker: Narrator

text: of Arod, the family of the Arodites; of Areli, the family of the Arelites.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the families of the sons of Gad according to those who were numbered of them, 40,500.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Judah were Er and Onan, but Er and Onan died in the land of Canaan.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Judah according to their families were: of Shelah, the family of the Shelanites; of Perez, the family of the Perezites; of Zerah, the family of the Zerahites.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Perez were: of Hezron, the family of the Hezronites; of Hamul, the family of the Hamulites.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the families of Judah according to those who were numbered of them, 76,500.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Issachar according to their families: of Tola, the family of the Tolaites; of Puvah, the family of the Punites;
speaker: Narrator

text: of Jashub, the family of the Jashubites; of Shimron, the family of the Shimronites.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the families of Issachar according to those who were numbered of them, 64,300.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Zebulun according to their families: of Sered, the family of the Seredites; of Elon, the family of the Elonites; of Jahleel, the family of the Jahleelites.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the families of the Zebulunites according to those who were numbered of them, 60,500.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Joseph according to their families: Manasseh and Ephraim.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Manasseh: of Machir, the family of the Machirites; and Machir became the father of Gilead: of Gilead, the family of the Gileadites.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the sons of Gilead: of Iezer, the family of the Iezerites; of Helek, the family of the Helekites;
speaker: Narrator

text: and of Asriel, the family of the Asrielites; and of Shechem, the family of the Shechemites;
speaker: Narrator

text: and of Shemida, the family of the Shemidaites; and of Hepher, the family of the Hepherites.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now Zelophehad the son of Hepher had no sons, but only daughters; and the names of the daughters of Zelophehad were Mahlah, Noah, Hoglah, Milcah and Tirzah.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the families of Manasseh; and those who were numbered of them were 52,700.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the sons of Ephraim according to their families: of Shuthelah, the family of the Shuthelahites; of Becher, the family of the Becherites; of Tahan, the family of the Tahanites.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the sons of Shuthelah: of Eran, the family of the Eranites.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the families of the sons of Ephraim according to those who were numbered of them, 32,500. These are the sons of Joseph according to their families.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Benjamin according to their families: of Bela, the family of the Belaites; of Ashbel, the family of the Ashbelites; of Ahiram, the family of the Ahiramites;
speaker: Narrator

text: of Shephupham, the family of the Shuphamites; of Hupham, the family of the Huphamites.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Bela were Ard and Naaman: of Ard, the family of the Ardites; of Naaman, the family of the Naamites.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the sons of Benjamin according to their families; and those who were numbered of them were 45,600.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the sons of Dan according to their families: of Shuham, the family of the Shuhamites. These are the families of Dan according to their families.
speaker: Narrator

text: All the families of the Shuhamites, according to those who were numbered of them, were 64,400.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Asher according to their families: of Imnah, the family of the Imnites; of Ishvi, the family of the Ishvites; of Beriah, the family of the Beriites.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of the sons of Beriah: of Heber, the family of the Heberites; of Malchiel, the family of the Malchielites.
speaker: Narrator

text: The name of the daughter of Asher was Serah.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the families of the sons of Asher according to those who were numbered of them, 53,400.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Naphtali according to their families: of Jahzeel, the family of the Jahzeelites; of Guni, the family of the Gunites;
speaker: Narrator

text: of Jezer, the family of the Jezerites; of Shillem, the family of the Shillemites.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the families of Naphtali according to their families; and those who were numbered of them were 45,400.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are those who were numbered of the sons of Israel, 601,730.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Lord spoke to Moses, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Among these the land shall be divided for an inheritance according to the number of names.
speaker: Narrator

text: To the larger group you shall increase their inheritance, and to the smaller group you shall diminish their inheritance; each shall be given their inheritance according to those who were numbered of them.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the land shall be divided by lot. They shall receive their inheritance according to the names of the tribes of their fathers.
speaker: Narrator

text: According to the selection by lot, their inheritance shall be divided between the larger and the smaller groups.”
speaker: Narrator

text: These are those who were numbered of the Levites according to their families: of Gershon, the family of the Gershonites; of Kohath, the family of the Kohathites; of Merari, the family of the Merarites.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the families of Levi: the family of the Libnites, the family of the Hebronites, the family of the Mahlites, the family of the Mushites, the family of the Korahites. Kohath became the father of Amram.
speaker: Narrator

text: The name of Amram’s wife was Jochebed, the daughter of Levi, who was born to Levi in Egypt; and she bore to Amram: Aaron and Moses and their sister Miriam.
speaker: Narrator

text: To Aaron were born Nadab and Abihu, Eleazar and Ithamar.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Nadab and Abihu died when they offered strange fire before the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those who were numbered of them were 23,000, every male from a month old and upward, for they were not numbered among the sons of Israel since no inheritance was given to them among the sons of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are those who were numbered by Moses and Eleazar the priest, who numbered the sons of Israel in the plains of Moab by the Jordan at Jericho.
speaker: Narrator

text: But among these there was not a man of those who were numbered by Moses and Aaron the priest, who numbered the sons of Israel in the wilderness of Sinai.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the Lord had said of them, “They shall surely die in the wilderness.” And not a man was left of them, except Caleb the son of Jephunneh and Joshua the son of Nun.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the daughters of Zelophehad, the son of Hepher, the son of Gilead, the son of Machir, the son of Manasseh, of the families of Manasseh the son of Joseph, came near; and these are the names of his daughters: Mahlah, Noah and Hoglah and Milcah and Tirzah.
speaker: Narrator

text: They stood before Moses and before Eleazar the priest and before the leaders and all the congregation, at the doorway of the tent of meeting, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Our father died in the wilderness, yet he was not among the company of those who gathered themselves together against the Lord in the company of Korah; but he died in his own sin, and he had no sons.
speaker: Narrator

text: Why should the name of our father be withdrawn from among his family because he had no son? Give us a possession among our father’s brothers.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Moses brought their case before the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Lord spoke to Moses, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “The daughters of Zelophehad are right in their statements. You shall surely give them a hereditary possession among their father’s brothers, and you shall transfer the inheritance of their father to them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Further, you shall speak to the sons of Israel, saying, ‘If a man dies and has no son, then you shall transfer his inheritance to his daughter.
speaker: Narrator

text: If he has no daughter, then you shall give his inheritance to his brothers.
speaker: Narrator

text: If he has no brothers, then you shall give his inheritance to his father’s brothers.
speaker: Narrator

text: If his father has no brothers, then you shall give his inheritance to his nearest relative in his own family, and he shall possess it; and it shall be a statutory ordinance to the sons of Israel, just as the Lord commanded Moses.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Lord said to Moses, “Go up to this mountain of Abarim, and see the land which I have given to the sons of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: When you have seen it, you too will be gathered to your people, as Aaron your brother was;
speaker: Narrator

text: for in the wilderness of Zin, during the strife of the congregation, you rebelled against My command to treat Me as holy before their eyes at the water.” (These are the waters of Meribah of Kadesh in the wilderness of Zin.)
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Moses spoke to the Lord, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “May the Lord, the God of the spirits of all flesh, appoint a man over the congregation,
speaker: Narrator

text: who will go out and come in before them, and who will lead them out and bring them in, so that the congregation of the Lord will not be like sheep which have no shepherd.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So the Lord said to Moses, “Take Joshua the son of Nun, a man in whom is the Spirit, and lay your hand on him;
speaker: Narrator

text: and have him stand before Eleazar the priest and before all the congregation, and commission him in their sight.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall put some of your authority on him, in order that all the congregation of the sons of Israel may obey him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover, he shall stand before Eleazar the priest, who shall inquire for him by the judgment of the Urim before the Lord. At his command they shall go out and at his command they shall come in, both he and the sons of Israel with him, even all the congregation.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses did just as the Lord commanded him; and he took Joshua and set him before Eleazar the priest and before all the congregation.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he laid his hands on him and commissioned him, just as the Lord had spoken through Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Lord spoke to Moses, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Command the sons of Israel and say to them, ‘You shall be careful to present My offering, My food for My offerings by fire, of a soothing aroma to Me, at their appointed time.’
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall say to them, ‘This is the offering by fire which you shall offer to the Lord: two male lambs one year old without defect as a continual burnt offering every day.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall offer the one lamb in the morning and the other lamb you shall offer at twilight;
speaker: Narrator

text: also a tenth of an ephah of fine flour for a grain offering, mixed with a fourth of a hin of beaten oil.
speaker: Narrator

text: It is a continual burnt offering which was ordained in Mount Sinai as a soothing aroma, an offering by fire to the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the drink offering with it shall be a fourth of a hin for each lamb, in the holy place you shall pour out a drink offering of strong drink to the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: The other lamb you shall offer at twilight; as the grain offering of the morning and as its drink offering, you shall offer it, an offering by fire, a soothing aroma to the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘Then on the sabbath day two male lambs one year old without defect, and two-tenths of an ephah of fine flour mixed with oil as a grain offering, and its drink offering:
speaker: Narrator

text: This is the burnt offering of every sabbath in addition to the continual burnt offering and its drink offering.
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘Then at the beginning of each of your months you shall present a burnt offering to the Lord: two bulls and one ram, seven male lambs one year old without defect;
speaker: Narrator

text: and three-tenths of an ephah of fine flour mixed with oil for a grain offering, for each bull; and two-tenths of fine flour mixed with oil for a grain offering, for the one ram;
speaker: Narrator

text: and a tenth of an ephah of fine flour mixed with oil for a grain offering for each lamb, for a burnt offering of a soothing aroma, an offering by fire to the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their drink offerings shall be half a hin of wine for a bull and a third of a hin for the ram and a fourth of a hin for a lamb; this is the burnt offering of each month throughout the months of the year.
speaker: Narrator

text: And one male goat for a sin offering to the Lord; it shall be offered with its drink offering in addition to the continual burnt offering.
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘Then on the fourteenth day of the first month shall be the Lord’s Passover.
speaker: Narrator

text: On the fifteenth day of this month shall be a feast, unleavened bread shall be eaten for seven days.

text: On the first day shall be a holy convocation; you shall do no laborious work.

speaker: Narrator

speaker: Narrator

speaker: Narrator

text: and one male goat for a sin offering to make atonement for you.
speaker: Narrator

speaker: Narrator

speaker: Narrator

speaker: Narrator

speaker: Narrator

speaker: Narrator

text: ‘You shall present these to the Lord at your appointed times, besides your votive offerings and your freewill offerings, for your burnt offerings and for your grain offerings and for your drink offerings and for your peace offerings.’”

text: Moses spoke to the sons of Israel in accordance with all that the Lord had commanded Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Moses spoke to the heads of the tribes of the sons of Israel, saying, “This is the word which the Lord has commanded.
speaker: Narrator

text: If a man makes a vow to the Lord, or takes an oath to bind himself with a binding obligation, he shall not violate his word; he shall do according to all that proceeds out of his mouth.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Also if a woman makes a vow to the Lord, and binds herself by an obligation in her father’s house in her youth,
speaker: Narrator

text: and her father hears her vow and her obligation by which she has bound herself, and her father says nothing to her, then all her vows shall stand and every obligation by which she has bound herself shall stand.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if her father should forbid her on the day he hears of it, none of her vows or her obligations by which she has bound herself shall stand; and the Lord will forgive her because her father had forbidden her.
speaker: Narrator

text: “However, if she should marry while under her vows or the rash statement of her lips by which she has bound herself,
speaker: Narrator

text: and her husband hears of it and says nothing to her on the day he hears it, then her vows shall stand and her obligations by which she has bound herself shall stand.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if on the day her husband hears of it, he forbids her, then he shall annul her vow which she is under and the rash statement of her lips by which she has bound herself; and the Lord will forgive her.
speaker: Narrator

text: “But the vow of a widow or of a divorced woman, everything by which she has bound herself, shall stand against her.
speaker: Narrator

text: However, if she vowed in her husband’s house, or bound herself by an obligation with an oath,
speaker: Narrator

text: and her husband heard it, but said nothing to her and did not forbid her, then all her vows shall stand and every obligation by which she bound herself shall stand.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if her husband indeed annuls them on the day he hears them, then whatever proceeds out of her lips concerning her vows or concerning the obligation of herself shall not stand; her husband has annulled them, and the Lord will forgive her.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Every vow and every binding oath to humble herself, her husband may confirm it or her husband may annul it.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if her husband indeed says nothing to her from day to day, then he confirms all her vows or all her obligations which are on her; he has confirmed them, because he said nothing to her on the day he heard them.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if he indeed annuls them after he has heard them, then he shall bear her guilt.”
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the statutes which the Lord commanded Moses, as between a man and his wife, and as between a father and his daughter, while she is in her youth in her father’s house.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Lord spoke to Moses, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Take full vengeance for the sons of Israel on the Midianites; afterward you will be gathered to your people.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses spoke to the people, saying, “Arm men from among you for the war, that they may go against Midian to execute the Lord’s vengeance on Midian.
speaker: Narrator

text: A thousand from each tribe of all the tribes of Israel you shall send to the war.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So there were furnished from the thousands of Israel, a thousand from each tribe, twelve thousand armed for war.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses sent them, a thousand from each tribe, to the war, and Phinehas the son of Eleazar the priest, to the war with them, and the holy vessels and the trumpets for the alarm in his hand.
speaker: Narrator

text: So they made war against Midian, just as the Lord had commanded Moses, and they killed every male.
speaker: Narrator

text: They killed the kings of Midian along with the rest of their slain: Evi and Rekem and Zur and Hur and Reba, the five kings of Midian; they also killed Balaam the son of Beor with the sword.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Israel captured the women of Midian and their little ones; and all their cattle and all their flocks and all their goods they plundered.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they burned all their cities where they lived and all their camps with fire.
speaker: Narrator

text: They took all the spoil and all the prey, both of man and of beast.
speaker: Narrator

text: They brought the captives and the prey and the spoil to Moses, and to Eleazar the priest and to the congregation of the sons of Israel, to the camp at the plains of Moab, which are by the Jordan opposite Jericho.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses and Eleazar the priest and all the leaders of the congregation went out to meet them outside the camp.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses was angry with the officers of the army, the captains of thousands and the captains of hundreds, who had come from service in the war.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Moses said to them, “Have you spared all the women?
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, these caused the sons of Israel, through the counsel of Balaam, to trespass against the Lord in the matter of Peor, so the plague was among the congregation of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now therefore, kill every male among the little ones, and kill every woman who has known man intimately.
speaker: Narrator

text: But all the girls who have not known man intimately, spare for yourselves.
speaker: Narrator

text: And you, camp outside the camp seven days; whoever has killed any person and whoever has touched any slain, purify yourselves, you and your captives, on the third day and on the seventh day.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall purify for yourselves every garment and every article of leather and all the work of goats’ hair, and all articles of wood.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Eleazar the priest said to the men of war who had gone to battle, “This is the statute of the law which the Lord has commanded Moses:
speaker: Narrator

text: only the gold and the silver, the bronze, the iron, the tin and the lead,
speaker: Narrator

text: everything that can stand the fire, you shall pass through the fire, and it shall be clean, but it shall be purified with water for impurity. But whatever cannot stand the fire you shall pass through the water.
speaker: Narrator

text: And you shall wash your clothes on the seventh day and be clean, and afterward you may enter the camp.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Lord spoke to Moses, saying,
speaker: Narrator

speaker: Narrator

speaker: Narrator

text: From the sons of Israel’s half, you shall take one drawn out of every fifty of the persons, of the cattle, of the donkeys and of the sheep, from all the animals, and give them to the Levites who keep charge of the tabernacle of the Lord.”

text: Then the officers who were over the thousands of the army, the captains of thousands and the captains of hundreds, approached Moses,
speaker: Narrator

text: and they said to Moses, “Your servants have taken a census of men of war who are in our charge, and no man of us is missing.

text: Moses and Eleazar the priest took the gold from them, all kinds of wrought articles.
