text: All the gold of the offering which they offered up to the Lord, from the captains of thousands and the captains of hundreds, was 16,750 shekels.
speaker: Narrator

text: The men of war had taken booty, every man for himself.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Moses and Eleazar the priest took the gold from the captains of thousands and of hundreds, and brought it to the tent of meeting as a memorial for the sons of Israel before the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the sons of Reuben and the sons of Gad had an exceedingly large number of livestock. So when they saw the land of Jazer and the land of Gilead, that it was indeed a place suitable for livestock,
speaker: Narrator

text: the sons of Gad and the sons of Reuben came and spoke to Moses and to Eleazar the priest and to the leaders of the congregation, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Ataroth, Dibon, Jazer, Nimrah, Heshbon, Elealeh, Sebam, Nebo and Beon,
speaker: Narrator

text: the land which the Lord conquered before the congregation of Israel, is a land for livestock, and your servants have livestock.”
speaker: Narrator

text: They said, “If we have found favor in your sight, let this land be given to your servants as a possession; do not take us across the Jordan.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But Moses said to the sons of Gad and to the sons of Reuben, “Shall your brothers go to war while you yourselves sit here?
speaker: Narrator

text: Now why are you discouraging the sons of Israel from crossing over into the land which the Lord has given them?
speaker: Narrator

text: This is what your fathers did when I sent them from Kadesh-barnea to see the land.
speaker: Narrator

text: For when they went up to the valley of Eshcol and saw the land, they discouraged the sons of Israel so that they did not go into the land which the Lord had given them.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the Lord’s anger burned in that day, and He swore, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘None of the men who came up from Egypt, from twenty years old and upward, shall see the land which I swore to Abraham, to Isaac and to Jacob; for they did not follow Me fully,
speaker: Narrator

text: except Caleb the son of Jephunneh the Kenizzite and Joshua the son of Nun, for they have followed the Lord fully.’
speaker: Narrator

text: So the Lord’s anger burned against Israel, and He made them wander in the wilderness forty years, until the entire generation of those who had done evil in the sight of the Lord was destroyed.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now behold, you have risen up in your fathers’ place, a brood of sinful men, to add still more to the burning anger of the Lord against Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: For if you turn away from following Him, He will once more abandon them in the wilderness, and you will destroy all these people.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they came near to him and said, “We will build here sheepfolds for our livestock and cities for our little ones;
speaker: Narrator

text: but we ourselves will be armed ready to go before the sons of Israel, until we have brought them to their place, while our little ones live in the fortified cities because of the inhabitants of the land.
speaker: Narrator

text: We will not return to our homes until every one of the sons of Israel has possessed his inheritance.
speaker: Narrator

text: For we will not have an inheritance with them on the other side of the Jordan and beyond, because our inheritance has fallen to us on this side of the Jordan toward the east.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Moses said to them, “If you will do this, if you will arm yourselves before the Lord for the war,
speaker: Narrator

text: and all of you armed men cross over the Jordan before the Lord until He has driven His enemies out from before Him,
speaker: Narrator

text: and the land is subdued before the Lord, then afterward you shall return and be free of obligation toward the Lord and toward Israel, and this land shall be yours for a possession before the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if you will not do so, behold, you have sinned against the Lord, and be sure your sin will find you out.
speaker: Narrator

text: Build yourselves cities for your little ones, and sheepfolds for your sheep, and do what you have promised.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Gad and the sons of Reuben spoke to Moses, saying, “Your servants will do just as my lord commands.
speaker: Narrator

text: Our little ones, our wives, our livestock and all our cattle shall remain there in the cities of Gilead;
speaker: Narrator

text: while your servants, everyone who is armed for war, will cross over in the presence of the Lord to battle, just as my lord says.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Moses gave command concerning them to Eleazar the priest, and to Joshua the son of Nun, and to the heads of the fathers’ households of the tribes of the sons of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses said to them, “If the sons of Gad and the sons of Reuben, everyone who is armed for battle, will cross with you over the Jordan in the presence of the Lord, and the land is subdued before you, then you shall give them the land of Gilead for a possession;
speaker: Narrator

text: but if they will not cross over with you armed, they shall have possessions among you in the land of Canaan.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Gad and the sons of Reuben answered, saying, “As the Lord has said to your servants, so we will do.
speaker: Narrator

text: We ourselves will cross over armed in the presence of the Lord into the land of Canaan, and the possession of our inheritance shall remain with us across the Jordan.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Moses gave to them, to the sons of Gad and to the sons of Reuben and to the half-tribe of Joseph’s son Manasseh, the kingdom of Sihon, king of the Amorites and the kingdom of Og, the king of Bashan, the land with its cities with their territories, the cities of the surrounding land.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Gad built Dibon and Ataroth and Aroer,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Atroth-shophan and Jazer and Jogbehah,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Beth-nimrah and Beth-haran as fortified cities, and sheepfolds for sheep.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Reuben built Heshbon and Elealeh and Kiriathaim,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Nebo and Baal-meon—their names being changed—and Sibmah, and they gave other names to the cities which they built.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Machir the son of Manasseh went to Gilead and took it, and dispossessed the Amorites who were in it.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Moses gave Gilead to Machir the son of Manasseh, and he lived in it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jair the son of Manasseh went and took its towns, and called them Havvoth-jair.
speaker: Narrator

text: Nobah went and took Kenath and its villages, and called it Nobah after his own name.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the journeys of the sons of Israel, by which they came out from the land of Egypt by their armies, under the leadership of Moses and Aaron.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses recorded their starting places according to their journeys by the command of the Lord, and these are their journeys according to their starting places.
speaker: Narrator

text: They journeyed from Rameses in the first month, on the fifteenth day of the first month; on the next day after the Passover the sons of Israel started out boldly in the sight of all the Egyptians,
speaker: Narrator

text: while the Egyptians were burying all their firstborn whom the Lord had struck down among them. The Lord had also executed judgments on their gods.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the sons of Israel journeyed from Rameses and camped in Succoth.
speaker: Narrator

text: They journeyed from Succoth and camped in Etham, which is on the edge of the wilderness.
speaker: Narrator

text: They journeyed from Etham and turned back to Pi-hahiroth, which faces Baal-zephon, and they camped before Migdol.
speaker: Narrator

text: They journeyed from before Hahiroth and passed through the midst of the sea into the wilderness; and they went three days’ journey in the wilderness of Etham and camped at Marah.
speaker: Narrator

text: They journeyed from Marah and came to Elim; and in Elim there were twelve springs of water and seventy palm trees, and they camped there.
speaker: Narrator

text: They journeyed from Elim and camped by the Red Sea.
speaker: Narrator

text: They journeyed from the Red Sea and camped in the wilderness of Sin.
speaker: Narrator

text: They journeyed from the wilderness of Sin and camped at Dophkah.
speaker: Narrator

text: They journeyed from Dophkah and camped at Alush.
speaker: Narrator

text: They journeyed from Alush and camped at Rephidim; now it was there that the people had no water to drink.
speaker: Narrator

text: They journeyed from Rephidim and camped in the wilderness of Sinai.
speaker: Narrator

text: They journeyed from the wilderness of Sinai and camped at Kibroth-hattaavah.
speaker: Narrator

text: They journeyed from Kibroth-hattaavah and camped at Hazeroth.
speaker: Narrator

text: They journeyed from Hazeroth and camped at Rithmah.
speaker: Narrator

text: They journeyed from Rithmah and camped at Rimmon-perez.
speaker: Narrator

text: They journeyed from Rimmon-perez and camped at Libnah.
speaker: Narrator

text: They journeyed from Libnah and camped at Rissah.
speaker: Narrator

text: They journeyed from Rissah and camped in Kehelathah.
speaker: Narrator

text: They journeyed from Kehelathah and camped at Mount Shepher.
speaker: Narrator

text: They journeyed from Mount Shepher and camped at Haradah.
speaker: Narrator

text: They journeyed from Haradah and camped at Makheloth.
speaker: Narrator

text: They journeyed from Makheloth and camped at Tahath.
speaker: Narrator

text: They journeyed from Tahath and camped at Terah.
speaker: Narrator

text: They journeyed from Terah and camped at Mithkah.
speaker: Narrator

text: They journeyed from Mithkah and camped at Hashmonah.
speaker: Narrator

text: They journeyed from Hashmonah and camped at Moseroth.
speaker: Narrator

text: They journeyed from Moseroth and camped at Bene-jaakan.
speaker: Narrator

text: They journeyed from Bene-jaakan and camped at Hor-haggidgad.
speaker: Narrator

text: They journeyed from Hor-haggidgad and camped at Jotbathah.
speaker: Narrator

text: They journeyed from Jotbathah and camped at Abronah.
speaker: Narrator

text: They journeyed from Abronah and camped at Ezion-geber.
speaker: Narrator

text: They journeyed from Ezion-geber and camped in the wilderness of Zin, that is, Kadesh.
speaker: Narrator

text: They journeyed from Kadesh and camped at Mount Hor, at the edge of the land of Edom.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Aaron the priest went up to Mount Hor at the command of the Lord, and died there in the fortieth year after the sons of Israel had come from the land of Egypt, on the first day in the fifth month.
speaker: Narrator

text: Aaron was one hundred twenty-three years old when he died on Mount Hor.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the Canaanite, the king of Arad who lived in the Negev in the land of Canaan, heard of the coming of the sons of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they journeyed from Mount Hor and camped at Zalmonah.
speaker: Narrator

text: They journeyed from Zalmonah and camped at Punon.
speaker: Narrator

text: They journeyed from Punon and camped at Oboth.
speaker: Narrator

text: They journeyed from Oboth and camped at Iye-abarim, at the border of Moab.
speaker: Narrator

text: They journeyed from Iyim and camped at Dibon-gad.
speaker: Narrator

text: They journeyed from Dibon-gad and camped at Almon-diblathaim.
speaker: Narrator

text: They journeyed from Almon-diblathaim and camped in the mountains of Abarim, before Nebo.
speaker: Narrator

text: They journeyed from the mountains of Abarim and camped in the plains of Moab by the Jordan opposite Jericho.
speaker: Narrator

text: They camped by the Jordan, from Beth-jeshimoth as far as Abel-shittim in the plains of Moab.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Lord spoke to Moses in the plains of Moab by the Jordan opposite Jericho, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Speak to the sons of Israel and say to them, ‘When you cross over the Jordan into the land of Canaan,
speaker: Narrator

text: then you shall drive out all the inhabitants of the land from before you, and destroy all their figured stones, and destroy all their molten images and demolish all their high places;
speaker: Narrator

text: and you shall take possession of the land and live in it, for I have given the land to you to possess it.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall inherit the land by lot according to your families; to the larger you shall give more inheritance, and to the smaller you shall give less inheritance. Wherever the lot falls to anyone, that shall be his. You shall inherit according to the tribes of your fathers.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if you do not drive out the inhabitants of the land from before you, then it shall come about that those whom you let remain of them will become as pricks in your eyes and as thorns in your sides, and they will trouble you in the land in which you live.
speaker: Narrator

text: And as I plan to do to them, so I will do to you.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Lord spoke to Moses, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Command the sons of Israel and say to them, ‘When you enter the land of Canaan, this is the land that shall fall to you as an inheritance, even the land of Canaan according to its borders.
speaker: Narrator

text: Your southern sector shall extend from the wilderness of Zin along the side of Edom, and your southern border shall extend from the end of the Salt Sea eastward.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then your border shall turn direction from the south to the ascent of Akrabbim and continue to Zin, and its termination shall be to the south of Kadesh-barnea; and it shall reach Hazaraddar and continue to Azmon.
speaker: Narrator

text: The border shall turn direction from Azmon to the brook of Egypt, and its termination shall be at the sea.
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘As for the western border, you shall have the Great Sea, that is, its coastline; this shall be your west border.
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘And this shall be your north border: you shall draw your border line from the Great Sea to Mount Hor.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall draw a line from Mount Hor to the Lebo-hamath, and the termination of the border shall be at Zedad;
speaker: Narrator

text: and the border shall proceed to Ziphron, and its termination shall be at Hazar-enan. This shall be your north border.
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘For your eastern border you shall also draw a line from Hazar-enan to Shepham,
speaker: Narrator

text: and the border shall go down from Shepham to Riblah on the east side of Ain; and the border shall go down and reach to the slope on the east side of the Sea of Chinnereth.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the border shall go down to the Jordan and its termination shall be at the Salt Sea. This shall be your land according to its borders all around.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Moses commanded the sons of Israel, saying, “This is the land that you are to apportion by lot among you as a possession, which the Lord has commanded to give to the nine and a half tribes.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the tribe of the sons of Reuben have received theirs according to their fathers’ households, and the tribe of the sons of Gad according to their fathers’ households, and the half-tribe of Manasseh have received their possession.
speaker: Narrator

text: The two and a half tribes have received their possession across the Jordan opposite Jericho, eastward toward the sunrising.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Lord spoke to Moses, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “These are the names of the men who shall apportion the land to you for inheritance: Eleazar the priest and Joshua the son of Nun.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall take one leader of every tribe to apportion the land for inheritance.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the names of the men: of the tribe of Judah, Caleb the son of Jephunneh.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of the tribe of the sons of Simeon, Samuel the son of Ammihud.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of the tribe of Benjamin, Elidad the son of Chislon.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of the tribe of the sons of Dan a leader, Bukki the son of Jogli.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of the sons of Joseph: of the tribe of the sons of Manasseh a leader, Hanniel the son of Ephod.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of the tribe of the sons of Ephraim a leader, Kemuel the son of Shiphtan.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of the tribe of the sons of Zebulun a leader, Elizaphan the son of Parnach.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of the tribe of the sons of Issachar a leader, Paltiel the son of Azzan.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of the tribe of the sons of Asher a leader, Ahihud the son of Shelomi.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of the tribe of the sons of Naphtali a leader, Pedahel the son of Ammihud.”
speaker: Narrator

text: These are those whom the Lord commanded to apportion the inheritance to the sons of Israel in the land of Canaan.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the Lord spoke to Moses in the plains of Moab by the Jordan opposite Jericho, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Command the sons of Israel that they give to the Levites from the inheritance of their possession cities to live in; and you shall give to the Levites pasture lands around the cities.
speaker: Narrator

text: The cities shall be theirs to live in; and their pasture lands shall be for their cattle and for their herds and for all their beasts.
speaker: Narrator

text: “The pasture lands of the cities which you shall give to the Levites shall extend from the wall of the city outward a thousand cubits around.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall also measure outside the city on the east side two thousand cubits, and on the south side two thousand cubits, and on the west side two thousand cubits, and on the north side two thousand cubits, with the city in the center. This shall become theirs as pasture lands for the cities.
speaker: Narrator

text: The cities which you shall give to the Levites shall be the six cities of refuge, which you shall give for the manslayer to flee to; and in addition to them you shall give forty-two cities.
speaker: Narrator

text: All the cities which you shall give to the Levites shall be forty-eight cities, together with their pasture lands.
speaker: Narrator

text: As for the cities which you shall give from the possession of the sons of Israel, you shall take more from the larger and you shall take less from the smaller; each shall give some of his cities to the Levites in proportion to his possession which he inherits.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Lord spoke to Moses, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Speak to the sons of Israel and say to them, ‘When you cross the Jordan into the land of Canaan,
speaker: Narrator

text: then you shall select for yourselves cities to be your cities of refuge, that the manslayer who has killed any person unintentionally may flee there.
speaker: Narrator

text: The cities shall be to you as a refuge from the avenger, so that the manslayer will not die until he stands before the congregation for trial.
speaker: Narrator

text: The cities which you are to give shall be your six cities of refuge.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall give three cities across the Jordan and three cities in the land of Canaan; they are to be cities of refuge.
speaker: Narrator

text: These six cities shall be for refuge for the sons of Israel, and for the alien and for the sojourner among them; that anyone who kills a person unintentionally may flee there.
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘But if he struck him down with an iron object, so that he died, he is a murderer; the murderer shall surely be put to death.
speaker: Narrator

text: If he struck him down with a stone in the hand, by which he will die, and as a result he died, he is a murderer; the murderer shall surely be put to death.
speaker: Narrator

text: Or if he struck him with a wooden object in the hand, by which he might die, and as a result he died, he is a murderer; the murderer shall surely be put to death.
speaker: Narrator

text: The blood avenger himself shall put the murderer to death; he shall put him to death when he meets him.
speaker: Narrator

text: If he pushed him of hatred, or threw something at him lying in wait and as a result he died,
speaker: Narrator

text: or if he struck him down with his hand in enmity, and as a result he died, the one who struck him shall surely be put to death, he is a murderer; the blood avenger shall put the murderer to death when he meets him.
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘But if he pushed him suddenly without enmity, or threw something at him without lying in wait,
speaker: Narrator

text: or with any deadly object of stone, and without seeing it dropped on him so that he died, while he was not his enemy nor seeking his injury,
speaker: Narrator

text: then the congregation shall judge between the slayer and the blood avenger according to these ordinances.
speaker: Narrator

text: The congregation shall deliver the manslayer from the hand of the blood avenger, and the congregation shall restore him to his city of refuge to which he fled; and he shall live in it until the death of the high priest who was anointed with the holy oil.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if the manslayer at any time goes beyond the border of his city of refuge to which he may flee,
speaker: Narrator

text: and the blood avenger finds him outside the border of his city of refuge, and the blood avenger kills the manslayer, he will not be guilty of blood
speaker: Narrator

text: because he should have remained in his city of refuge until the death of the high priest. But after the death of the high priest the manslayer shall return to the land of his possession.
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘These things shall be for a statutory ordinance to you throughout your generations in all your dwellings.
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘If anyone kills a person, the murderer shall be put to death at the evidence of witnesses, but no person shall be put to death on the testimony of one witness.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover, you shall not take ransom for the life of a murderer who is guilty of death, but he shall surely be put to death.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall not take ransom for him who has fled to his city of refuge, that he may return to live in the land before the death of the priest.
speaker: Narrator

text: So you shall not pollute the land in which you are; for blood pollutes the land and no expiation can be made for the land for the blood that is shed on it, except by the blood of him who shed it.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall not defile the land in which you live, in the midst of which I dwell; for I the Lord am dwelling in the midst of the sons of Israel.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: And the heads of the fathers’ households of the family of the sons of Gilead, the son of Machir, the son of Manasseh, of the families of the sons of Joseph, came near and spoke before Moses and before the leaders, the heads of the fathers’ households of the sons of Israel,
speaker: Narrator

text: and they said, “The Lord commanded my lord to give the land by lot to the sons of Israel as an inheritance, and my lord was commanded by the Lord to give the inheritance of Zelophehad our brother to his daughters.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if they marry one of the sons of the other tribes of the sons of Israel, their inheritance will be withdrawn from the inheritance of our fathers and will be added to the inheritance of the tribe to which they belong; thus it will be withdrawn from our allotted inheritance.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the jubilee of the sons of Israel comes, then their inheritance will be added to the inheritance of the tribe to which they belong; so their inheritance will be withdrawn from the inheritance of the tribe of our fathers.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Moses commanded the sons of Israel according to the word of the Lord, saying, “The tribe of the sons of Joseph are right in their statements.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is what the Lord has commanded concerning the daughters of Zelophehad, saying, ‘Let them marry whom they wish; only they must marry within the family of the tribe of their father.’
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus no inheritance of the sons of Israel shall be transferred from tribe to tribe, for the sons of Israel shall each hold to the inheritance of the tribe of his fathers.
speaker: Narrator

text: Every daughter who comes into possession of an inheritance of any tribe of the sons of Israel shall be wife to one of the family of the tribe of her father, so that the sons of Israel each may possess the inheritance of his fathers.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus no inheritance shall be transferred from one tribe to another tribe, for the tribes of the sons of Israel shall each hold to his own inheritance.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Just as the Lord had commanded Moses, so the daughters of Zelophehad did:
speaker: Narrator

text: Mahlah, Tirzah, Hoglah, Milcah and Noah, the daughters of Zelophehad married their uncles’ sons.
speaker: Narrator

text: They married those from the families of the sons of Manasseh the son of Joseph, and their inheritance remained with the tribe of the family of their father.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the commandments and the ordinances which the Lord commanded to the sons of Israel through Moses in the plains of Moab by the Jordan opposite Jericho.
speaker: Narrator
